The rooms are clean and modern with relatively spacious bathrooms including a walk-in shower. There is free WIFI in the bedrooms but don't forget to ask for separate codes for different appliances. We found the hotel very well located - short walks to many of the attractions. The breakfast buffet was uninspiring and much better value can be found in the local area. We would definitely stay here again.

title: No for the average tourist
review: Dear guest. Thank you so much for being here with us at Ayre Hoteles! And, of course, to gift us a few minutes to share your experience!!! We're pleased to see this, and we thank your comments regarding bar and breakfast, we'll work on that! Thank you once more! Hope to see you again so soon in BCN and Ayre Hoteles :)

title: Very Pleasant
review: This hotel was all we wanted for our extended weekend, and a bit more. Friendly and helpful staff, clean rooms and close to the centre of Barcelona. Both bathtub and shower, complimentary water and a nice bar. Wifi a bit poor, but the hotel is still highly recommended by us.

title: Clean and Comfortable.
review: I stayed here from October 9th to the 12th after disembarking from a cruise ship.  The hotel is a little bit out of the way but was close enough to walk to most of the sights such as the Sagrada, La Rambla and the Barcelona Cathedral.  The staff were very friendly and helpful, providing tickets for the Sagrada Familia that allowed us front of the line access with the services of a very competent guide from Julia Travel.  They also recommended 2 local restaurants that we enjoyed Our room was clean and tidy and had excellent WiFi reception. I would gladly recommend this hotel to friends and other travelers.

title: Poor Wifi Connection
review: Dear, we'd like to thank the time you dedicate us writings those kind lines! Hope to see you again so soon to continue your BCN Experience!!! Greetings

title: Great hotel and helpful staff
review: Nice and clean hotel.. but there were no water boiler in our room so it's difficult for us to have some hot tea..   The wifi connection was very unstable.. but still can connect sometimes..   the location is only few blocks away from Plaza De Catalunya and it's very near to Mango Outlet Location (since one of my destination to Barcelona was that outlet).   there's a chinese restaurant near this hotel with "Singapore Airlines" sticker on the window. I just found out that SQ girl are often went there to have some meals cause it was delicious.

title: Nice hotel in great location
review: Dear nandakarina! Thank you for visiting us!!! And for sharing your Ayre Experience!!! Regarding the hot water...by the moment (at least) kettles makes no part of the room amenities, but our staff is always ready to help you providing it anytime!!! Greetings from BCN :)

title: Nice Hotel - great staff.
review: This was our first hotel to stay in during our travel in Spain and It did not disappoint. The room was nice and clean, bed was comfortable.  Staff were extremely helpful and answered all our questions and enquirers.   location is good although it's a bit of walk to the heart of the city.

title: Good location, hotel is ok!
review: I had a chance to stay at this hotel from 30-Sep to 02-Oct. Overall good hotel, though small. Bathrooms & rooms are of good size. Location is also good, 7-10 minutes walk from key tourist locations and also to Metro stations. Although not on main street. I was disappointed for not having iron in the room nor available from room sevice, but the laundry service was fairly quick and helpful. Overall staff was very helpful as well.

title: Lovely place on the whole
review: Dear Omar, we're so glad to receive you as our guest. Thank you for visiting us! Regarding irons and boards, by the moment we're offering only the ironing service (paid for) during the mornings (every day), and room service is open from 08 am to 11 pm also everydays, but we're sure our teams will do the best to satisfy all your needs. Please don't hesitate in contacting us for anything you might consider. Greetings from Barcelona!

title: Good location for an independent and active traveller
review: This hotel is probably a business hotel during the week. The staff are mostly pleasant and professional. The breakfast is great value and the rooms are a good size and really clean. Its a fair stretch into the Ramblas but only 6 euro back in a taxi. Sagrada is closer and there are lots of restaurants and low key bars nearby. Barcelona is a great place to visit, the open top bus soon helps you to discover that everywhere is within easy reach and there are many fabulous sights. We will visit again but will probably look for something more authentic to stay in.

title: Nice Hotel
review: Dear, we're so glad to see your stay in Ayre Hoteles has been pleasant, all our staff is up to satisfy every single need. Please stay tuned with us on our social networks, surprises are coming! Greetings from Barcelona!

title: Excellent rooms
review: The Ayre Hotel caspe has an excellent location, being at walking distance (half an hour) from beaches near Olimpic Village, Sagrada Familia, etc (excepting Park Guell and Montjuic which require a bus). This is very good for an active travellers, willing not just to see local attractions, but also to walk for identyfying local atmosphere. Rooms and service are excellent, so you can refresh yourself in afternoon and evening. There is a bit of noise from the road around 6 am, but this should not be a problem for those willing to visit the city from 7.30-8.00 am (when the streets are not crowded).

title: Ayre Hotel Caspe - Barcelona 29.8.13
review: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights with my 17 year old daughter.  The hotel was very clean and the staff extremely helpful and friendly.  The only exception was that on a couple of occasions we found that the towels were discoloured.  We ate a couple of times in the hotel restaurant and particularly enjoyed the prawns.  Wasn't too impressed with the gnocchi.  The breakfast was buffet, all you can eat, mainly pastries, juice, salad and fruit salad.  If you wanted a cooked breakfast then the staff would order it separately for you.  The hotel is about a 20 minute walk from Las Ramblas and about a 35 minute walk to the beach.  We chose to walk everywhere and not use public transport.  The weather was great and it was easy to find our way around.  The hotel staff were fantastic at…

title: Decent Location.  Helpful Staff.
review: Dear Trish, we appreciate so much your sweet words. Thank you!!! Please contact us for any further issue or even future bookings!!! Hope to see you again soon :) Greetings!

title: Perfect for La Sagrada Familia
review: Hotel was in decent location, about 10 minutes walk from the subway.  Staff was friendly and spoke great English. It was a nice modern looking hotel.  Rooms were above average, nice and clean.  Value for the money was above average.

title: Service made the difference
review: Thank you so much for being here with us at Ayre Caspe. Hope to see you again so soon! Greetings :)

title: Great Hotel, Good Location
review: Took my mum to this hotel for her 80th birthday so we could see the main Gaudi sites. It has a modern, design-feel with very comfortable,modern, spacious rooms. Breakfast is superb- the only European hotel I have EVER stayed in which had freshly squeezed orange  juice at breakfast AND decent coffee from an industrial sized Nespresso machine. Bliss! Staff were courteous,friendly and treated my mum with great respect.The lovely barman Luis made a fuss of her when he heard about her birthday-these touches make a difference.Hotel is within easy walking distance of La Sagrada Familia, even for my mum who has limited mobility. There's no restaurant for evening meals-you can get decent but limited food in the bar which if empty lacks atmosphere but is friendly and efficient. I would…

title: Modern hotel
review: Hotel is very modern and new.  It does not have the smell of old carpet like some hotels as floor is not carpeted. Rooms are of pretty good size with a long working table and free wifi.  Bathroom comes with a separate shower area and bath tub.   The downside of the hotel is that it is not located within short walk to Placa Catalunya.  And there is no kettle in the room to boil hot water to make coffee or tea.

title: Very helpful staff.
review: Dear YinMun, thank you so much for being here with us and to share your experience! Hope to see you again soon in Barcelona, maybe this time with the kettle ;)

title: Nice clean modern hotel
review: This is a clean modern hotel located 10mins from centre of town, in safe quiet area.  The staff on front desk and in the restaurant were so helpful and speak perfect English.  We were able to walk everywhere from here. Good bathroom with strong shower.

title: Good hotel
review: Dear guest, we are so happy reading this kind of reviews. Thank you!!! Please contact us for anything you might consider necessary!!! We're at your entire disposal. Hoping to see you again so soon, we send you our best wishes!

title: Excellent value and service - good base for visit
review: The rooms are very nice and clean and modern.  The staff is very helpful.  This hotel is located in the Eixample neighborhood near the Arc de triumf  It is about 7 minutes walking (I am a New Yorker) from Plaza Catalunya.  The neighborhood is nice and safe and it was nice to be right outside of the tourist district.  I would stay there again.

title: Beautiful Barcelona
review: Stayed in the hotel for two nights and was able to reach everywhere on foot. Quite close to sacra familia and the city centre -20 min walk. Nice buffet breakfast! Room was compact but had everything we needed. Would recommend to other visitors!

title: hotel location is 20 mins walk from main attractions
review: Many thanks for your sweet comments!!! We hope to see you again soon!!!

title: Very pleasant place to stay at!
review: Location not the best, 20 mins walk from main attractions. Located in residential area but safe to walk at night. Hotel room is newly renovated but cleanliness can be an issue. First room allocated to us had a horrible stench that was probably from lack of cleaning in toilet.  Staff changed room promptly but did nothing to apologize for bad room. Staff training needed.

title: The perfect location
review: We are honored to have been chosen by you for your stay in this wonderful city. Thank you so much!!! Regarding your comment, we apologize if the room wasn't in perfect conditions, and to disturb you moving from one room to another, please allow me to ask you to accept them. I beg you to contact us for anything you might consider necessary at socialmedia.caspe@ayrehoteles.com. Greetings from Barcelona and thank you once more!

title: Great Hotel
review: Very comfortable and clean hotel with friendly and multilingual staff. We have been travelling with a child, and I was surprised by the consideration and care of the staff member at the reception who has offered us a room with a double bed instead of a room with two separate beds. Hotel is located in quite and safe are. Plenty of bars and cafes around.

title: Ayre Caspe Barcelona
review: Barcelona, fantastic city for culture AND beach. I went primarily for the beach & chose this hotel for its location. 10 minutes stroll into the centre & 10 minutes bus ride to the beach. The hotel itself is fresh & modern. Couldn’t fault it for the price we paid. Staff very friendly & welcoming. Room was as you would expect.

title: splendid
review: Dear Matty, thank you so much for your cute words you dedicate us! It's lovely to see our daily efforts to satisfy our guests are growing and having effects! Hope to see you again so soon! Keep in touch on our social channels, news are coming!!! Greetings!

title: Ver good and clean!
review: fresh, swift elevators, perfect staff, nice bar, local to everything that's good in barca. would easily recommend...cant think of a complaint except the beds being a tiny bit uncomfortable...but its not the ritz. maid service was impeccable, which helped a lot for finding misplaced watches and socks...

title: Good Location, Friendly Staff, Good Breakfast
review: Dear Craig, we're so glad to see this kind of reviews!!! Thank you!!!! We apologize as well if the bed wasn't as comfortable as you wished, we try always to set a media hardness. Hope to see you again so soon here in Barcelona! Greetings!

title: very nice hotel in a good location
review: This is a very good hotel I say 4 stars is very accurate! has good service and staff are friendly and helpful with any questions, queries and problems. It was very quiet and didn't hear any noise which is always good, however views from my room was the hallway of the hotel. Room was very clean and had air conditioning, also accommodates you with the option of adjoining rooms for families. The hotel is in a perfect position near places like the ramblas and sagrada familia, the zoo and the beach, however more further for Barcelona football stadium and the magic fountain. Taxis aren't too bad to get around places, charge bout 7-10 euros and takes 10-15 mins but on foot is good as well and it doesn't take much time to reach places if you like sightseeing.    The two downsides to…

title: Perfect
review: I have no complaints about this hotel. I stayed solo for 4 nights and was very happy with my room. Although my window looked into the hotel, which meant I couldn't really open the curtains and have privacy, the air conditioning did it's job.   Room was very clean and a good size for me. Bathroom was everything I needed. I liked the shower being separate from the bath and simple to use. The free wifi worked well for me.  I didn't take the breakfast so I can't comment on that. I did use room service once, it was quick (took 20 minutes just as they told me it would) and the food was good.  I found the location good. Took me about 20 mins to walk from the airport bus at Placa Catalunya. Nearest metro station at Tetuan was a 5-10 min walk, from there you can go anywhere. Sagrada…

title: Good hotel with excellent breakfast
review: Dear guest, thank you for this brillant review, it help us to see our guest's experience! Please stay in touch on our social channels, soon we'll have news!!! Greetings from Barcelona !!!

title: Friendly, helpful staff
review: We stayed three two nights at Ayre Caspe early July. I think that the location is good if you want to use the subway, which I recommend because it's easy, fast and cheep. We went by foot to Sagrada Familla and also to Ramblas, but also used the subway for coming back from the centre. I chose this hotel because it's close to the main bus station that takes to Girona airport. That was a good choise; the bus takes you in only 1 hour directly to the airport. A return ticket costs 25e / person.   The hotel is very clean and modern. The room was a bit disappointing as we didn't have a view at all and as the room is tiny it felt more like a cabin on a cruise ship.. What I liked was the separated shower / bath tub system. I'm so glad we took the breaklfast because it was absolutely…

title: Far from city center
review: Dear guest, we are so delighful about your review, specially on the breakfast. Regarding the room, our teams are always ready to change it in case it doesn't fit at your expectations. Please stay in touch with us on our social networks, soon we'll have good news!!! Greetings.

title: We'll come again
review: Staff very friendly and helpful, you can book tickets for camp nou experience at front desk and if you want to buy tickets in advance for la sagrada familia (rather than queue in the sun for hours!) la caixa bank on the corner, few feet from hotel has self serve machines which prints off tickets.   The hotel is very clean, nice shower and bath and free wifi, we were on the 7th floor and always had a good connection and signal.    Buffet breakfast has good selection, eggs and other hot food cooked to order.   Hotel is a short walk to arc de triomf, la sagrada familia 10-15 mins. Hotel is in a nice area, no night noise.   My only dislike was the beds can be on the hard side. Otherwise, fantastic hotel.

title: Great hotel for Barcelona sightseeing
review: My mother and I are from New Zealand and stayed here for 3nights at the end of July 2013. The staff are friendly and can speak english which was so helpful for us who have no spanish. The room had a good sized bathroom with shower and separate bath. The twin room we stayed in had comfortable beds, extra blankets and good air con.  Great location for sightseeing; was less than 20min walk to Sagrada Familia and from there we walked to Casa Battlo in about the same time. We also walked to and from La Ramblas shopping area with ease. Taxi from Barcelona Sants station was €12 and from hotel to international airport was €25.  Restaurant food was delicious and so reasonably priced for a hotel where generally food prices are well above average for the country.  Excellent value for money…

title: Good hotel w/ helpful staff & good location
review: Dear Eleanor, i might suppose that we'll meet once more! Hope to see you again so soon, it will be our pleasure. Your sweet words encourage us to stay in the working line we are. Every single suggestion or opinion will be very welcome. Feel free to contact us for anything you might consider at socialmedia.caspe@ayrehoteles.com. Thank you!

title: July 2013 Visit to Ayre/Caspe
review: Spent early July at the Ayre Hotel Caspe and it was very comfortable, well located, and the staff was very helpful. The room was good and although there were large groups staying at the hotel, there was no noise.   There was nothing special about the hotel but I would stay again based on price & location. It also helps when the staff goes out of their way to be helpful.  Hint - if looking for a great beach, go to Castelldefel Beach. It is about a 20 minute drive - taxi (35 euro) or #14 bus (2 euro/person).  Much better then the Barcelona beached. Definitely take the bus.

title: excellent rooms, excellent staff, excellent service
review: Dear guest, we're so happy to had you here with us, and we'll be so glad to guest you once more, just stay connected with us for anything you consider necessary. Thank you, besides, for sharing your suggestions about the beach; Barcelona have a lot of choices for enjoying the sun and the sea, like Barceloneta (central) or Nova Icaria, Marbella, ecc; and of course if you don't mind to step on a bus or train, you might visit other points like Gava, Castelldefells, Sitges (on South), or Tossa de Mar, Calella (North) (Tip for your next visit!!!!). Greetings from Barcelona

title: Very Good
review: A+.  This is a business class hotel at tourist prices.  The facility is new and modern and service was excellent.  Everyone at the front desk was great, spoke excellent English and helped me out on numerous occasions.  The location is in a quiet neighborhood, a five minute walk from a Metro station which will get you anywhere you want to be in 10-15 minutes.  The walk between the Metro and hotel had numerous restaurants and markets; very handy.  On top of that, the room had a small fridge stocked with free bottled water, a safe and there was a fitness center on the lower level.

title: Great stay
review: Stayed here for 4 nights. Hotel was very clean and staff very friendly. Free wifi and bottled water in the fridge was a lovely touch. Would recommended to family and friends. Approx a 20 min walk to both la ramblas and the beach.

title: Everything is more expensive in Barcelona
review: Dear Maddy! Delighful words you dedicate us! Thank you so much! We appreciate your election, choosing us, and of course, we appreciate you would reccomend us...please stay in contact with us at socialmedia.caspe@ayrehoteles.com to any further suggestion, comments or even future reservations, we'll be pleased to guest you once more! Greetings from the sunny Barcelona :)

title: Not the worst but certainly not the best
review: Otherwise this would be a 5. Off the beaten path a bit -- that's good. Walking distance to central square and Sagrada Familia Cathedral; 2 1/2 blocks to metro stop. Awesome breakfast / feel safe in this hotel. Each room has a safe at no cost. Several local cafes in neighborhood. Would stay again.

title: 4 star service
review: Dear kansasfan, thank you for your review! We appreciate the fact you choose us to spend your days in this lovely city, as well as spending your time to write this lines. Please don't hesitate in contacting us at socialmedia.caspe@ayrehoteles.com to any further information and even future reservations, we're at your service! Thank you!!!

title: HAPPINESS IN BARCELONA
review: My first impression of this hotel was really good. The rooms are small but vey nice. But some of the hotel staff don't speak very good English at all. The cleaning staff removed some bottles of water that I had bought. So I called the front desk to complain and ask that some be brought to my room. The guy barely spoke English but I'm quite sure he said he would send some more up. It never happened.  The beds are horrible. Rock hard. My ribs actually hurt by the second night from sleeping on my stomach.  The location isn't that great either. It's a 20 min walk to La Ramblas. Closeish to Sagrada Familia though.  Altogether a 'meh' hotel.

title: Hotel of choice if I go back to Barcelona!
review: Excellent hotel, in a very nice area, 10 minutes on foot from Plaza Catalunya ! Staff was very nice, available at all times, answering all our questions and giving us tips about Barcelona. When we left we needed to check if the bag was over the weight limit to not pay extra at the airport and they weighted it for us with a smile. I've asked for this at other hotels during my trips and usually the answer is a simple "we can't, sorry". Rooms are large, clean, the furniture is modern, beds are big and confortable. Bathroom is modern and big, with lots of toilettries. Had no problem finding the hotel and I agree with other reviewers using the Agbar Tower as a landmark ! We didn't have breakfast at the hotel but it looked nice. The hotel is close to Tetuan metro but also to Plaza…

title: Great stay - can't wait to go back!
review: Dear Ruluca, we're so delighted for your review! Thank you! We're proud to see our daily efforts to offer a quality service are being considered by our guests. We'll be pleased to guest you once more anytime, just keep in touch with us at socialmedia.caspe@ayrehoteles.com. Greetings from barcelona!

title: A Good Hotel
review: Just got back from a short break with my boyfriend. Great hotel, staff are very welcoming especially Sandra who works on reception who was very helpful in telling us what there is to do in Barcelona and helped us with map directions. Hotel is very clean and modern, comfy beds and a good bathroom with 2 seperate showers and a bath - perfect if you have a little one or want to relax after a long day of walking! Food in the hotel is good, personally felt that there wasn't a lot of selection for dinner but there are plenty of little cafes near by. Could not fault the service, was throughly looked after by all staff. Maid did a fantastic job of cleaning the room and even went as far as neatly folding my boyfriends smelly pants haha!  Location of the hotel is great, pretty much…

title: Good location, great room
review: Dear Hannah, we're so delightful with this review!!! Thank you so so much!!! Sandra will be happy to see it! We appreciate the fact you choose us to spend your days in this lovely city, as well as spending your time to write this lines. Please don't hesitate in contacting us at socialmedia.caspe@ayrehoteles.com to any further information and even future reservations, we're at your service! Thank you!!!

title: Convenient location, welcoming staff
review: We stayed for  three nights at the Ayre Hotel Caspe during our holiday last month in Barcelona. It was located in a nice neighbourhood. The nearest metro stop was Arc De Triumph and its about 10 minutes walk from the station to the hotel and 10-15 minutes walk  to the famous La Ramblas and Catalunya where you can board the touristic buses and also the Aero Bus to the airport. There are also a Chinese Restaurant nearby the hotel and convenience store as well as cafes so getting hungry is not a problem. The hotel offers a buffet breakfast at 12 Euros. We had a very nice room at the end of the corridor with a double bed. The room was clean with a good size bathroom and amenities. Staff were very welcoming and overall our stay at this hotel was very good.

title: Excellent Hotel
review: We stayed at the Ayre Hotel Caspe on our recent trip to Barcelona. Being from North America, we did not know the Ayre Hotel brand so other than the tripadvisor reviews, did not know what to expect. You might also be in the same boat. From our experience there was not need to worry - it was an awesome hotel! The hotel is located on a quieter street in Barcelona. This is a good thing as the main tourist areas of Barcelona are really chaotic.  The hotel is located a 10-15 minute walk away from the main tourist attractions. It is a nice walk along a lovely street  - so don't be at all concerned about the walk - we even walked home at 1am and it was fine. The hotel staff were wonderful and professional from the moment we walked in. We were greeted by lovely desk staff and were…

title: Very clean and comfortable!
review: Well, what else could I add…nothing but being astonished and very glad seeing this kind of reviews, specially from a Senior Traveller! Thank you so much! We also hope to see you again soon!!! Greetings from Barcelona :)

title: Wonderful place to stay
review: We really enjoyed our stay in Ayre hotel Caspe. The hotel is modern, clean and and we had a very comfortable stay. I love the decor of the hotel especially the lobby. The staff are very friendly and very helpful. The staff had very good English and they shared their knowledge of the city with us to make our stay in Barcelona more worthwhile. We didn't book B&B so I can't comment on the food but the bar is charming and the bar staff are again very friendly and were very helpful in telling us where to eat locally that isn't too expensive. It's located very near to the Cathedral (Sagrada Familia), within walking distance of 10 mins. We drove to Barcelona and had difficulties in finding the hotel, we first arrived at their sister hotel in the main square but they gave us a map to…

title: Nice and pleasent stay!
review: Dear guest: Your words are astonishing!!! Thank you!!! Receiving this kind of reviews from a critic is so delightful. We feel so happy to satisfy your expectations, and it will be a pleasure guesting you once more, please don't hesitate in contacting us anytime at socialmedia.caspe@ayrehoteles.com. Thank you so much!

title: Excellent Barcelona base
review: Needing a place to stay before a cruise, you never know what to expect in europe for hotels.  Ratings can be deceiving when it comes to international.  This was a gem.  I was so happy with this hotel that it will be THE place for me to come back to in Barcelona.  Super friendly staff always looking to bend over backwards to help you and accomodate your every wishes.  We needed a taxi in the morning and they called immediately and escorted me out and then wished us a pleasant trip.  Outstanding service.  The place is convenient to walk the city as well.  Many places that are within walking distance... so we did.

title: Very nice hotel, very happy indeed. Not far from centre, near bus and metro, excellent value.
review: We arrived by train from Girona and got off in Passeig de Gracia and walked, it was a bit far with a big case but we got there eventually. We were told they were making the room up so we left and went for a walk by the Arc de Triomf, and the park near the zoo, all very close and the streets are all so lovey, you will be taking photos of all the beautiful buildings. The hotel is also 15 mins from the Sagrada Famila and Nord station, it's about 20 mins or so walking to the Ramblas but I don't know why people make such a big deal about that as it's so crowded, you wouldn't want a hotel there anyway.   The area around this hotel is predominantly Chinese shops and Spanish tapas bars with Chinese owners, Chinese nail bars and hairdressers etc, but it's very safe to walk around and…

title: An excellent place to stay in Barca.
review: Dear Mr. Alex, we're so proud receiving this astonishing review form a Senior Reviewer!!! Thank you very much!!! Hope you contact us before you plan your return at socialmedia.caspe@ayrehoteles.com, we'll love to guest you once more!!! I feel so sorry about the weather...but i'm sure you used the time you had to see the city in a particular way! Keep in touch and have a wonderful and a happy week!!! Yours, SocialMedia Manager - Ayre Hotel Caspe

title: Very Friendly Desk Staff!
review: Staying here for five nights and this hotel is perfect for our requirements. It is spotlessly clean, exceptionally quiet (room 720) and the staff are gems. We don't use breakfast as it sounds expensive bit plenty cafe bars around for a quick early bite which is what we do.  Reception staff are most helpful especially Jordi who recommend restaurants, travel requirements and directions. He even advised best way to get to the Camp Nou for the game. I messed up the safe code and he was there in five mins to rectify.  Any reference to hard beds in other reviews don't understand quality. Any reference to bad location are those who do not wish a quiet night's sleep. The hotel is exactly an easy 20 min walk to the Placa Catalunya which leads to Las Ramblas. If you sincerely think that…

title: Very Nice Stay
review: Dear Guest, we appreciate so much your distinguished words, really prouds us!!! Regarding the breakfast, I hope at your return can try our Menu Breakfasts at €4!!! Will love it i bet!!! So i invite you to keep in touch with us at socialmedia.caspe@ayrehoteles.com for further comments, suggestions or reservations!!! Thank you! (PS: Jordi salutes you!!!)

title: Lovely modern hotel
review: If you need a big room, this would not be the place. But it was clean and had anything you would need. We walked and took the Metro, and were able to visit anywhere that we were interested in going. The staff all speak lovely English and other languages as well for tourists. They have maps and will explain how to best reach places. There was an elevator for hauling luggage, and the room was modern. I would stay there again if we need a place to crash in Barcelona before or after a cruise.

title: An excellent hotel
review: We stayed at the hotel for a week with the family. The hotel is located in a quite, but central, neighbourhood -in the center of a "triangle" of easy 15 minutes walk from the Gothic region\ the Ramblas, Plaza Catalunya and the famous Gaudi Cathedral.  Top clean nice rooms, excellent breakfast. Friendly team. My choise again when I'll be back to Barcelona.

title: Good location, good value
review: Dear guest: We appreciate so much the kind words you dedicate to us. Please don't hesitate in contacting us for any doubt, suggestion or future reservations at socialmedia.caspe@ayrehoteles.com. We'll be glad to guest you once more!!! Greetings

title: Hard beds and pillows....ok for one night stay.
review: We have just returned from Barcelona and stayed for two nights in Ayre Casp. First impression was good made better by a very friendly check in, loaded with information about this wonderful city.  The hotel is clean and functional, rooms are good but don't expect a view, or tea and coffee in the room.  But, if you are looking for a good base to explore then this is it. Close to the metro and in walking distance of Sagrada Familia and Catalunya Square and Las Ramblas for the markets, shopping and site seeing. Nearby restaurants are good with a number of bars for a coffee.  In the other direction is Glories and to the south the beach and harbour. With a gym on site if that's your thing and free wifi! Overall a great, reasonable,friendly and very helpful hotel.

title: Hot & stuffy rooms!!!
review: Dear guest: We appreciate so much the time you dedicate to write this review. We are to happy to satisfy your expectatives as your words are saying. Hope to see you again very soon, don't hesitate in contacting us at socialmedia.caspe@ayrehoteles.com to any request or suggestion. Yours, SocialMedia Manager - Ayre Hotel Caspe. Barcelona!

title: First stop to our European trip
review: We were only in Barcelona for one night, so I chose the Ayre Caspe based on it's location - which was great - walking distance to Sagrada Famailia.  If I went back to Barcelona, I would definitely stay at a different hotel.  The rooms are very modern and neat looking, but quite small.  Our room looked over an interior courtyard - and with blackout blinds it was still a bit light in our room. I can't believe ANYONE one would say that the beds were comfortable - they were like sleeping on the floor - and the pillows were like rocks!  They had a great TV selection with plenty of channels in English - and the WIFI worked like a charm.  The one bonus of the hotel was the restaurant.  We were exhausted from walking around Barcelona, and didn't want to go for dinner after 8 (some of…

title: Nice, well located hotel
review: Coming on the Barcelona Bus from Girona Airport, Ayre Hotel Caspe was really well located: less than a five minute walk from Barelona Nord station. The area doesn't have much character and, yes, it's a fair walk to Las Ramblas, but given the city's excellent-value public transport and this hotel's proximity to Arc De Triomf, the main sights are just a short journey away.  We didn't have breakfast because it cost €15 and with so many good bakeries nearby, it just didn't seem worth it.  The staff were polite and professional, although the receptionist did give us completely incorrect information about the return bus to Girona, so it was a good thing I double-checked at the kiosk at Barcelona Nord.  Our standard room was decorated with the usual modern decor, and not particularly…

title: 4 Stars. Really?
review: The positives are quiet location (in room 215, which is not on the street side), short walk to the subway, comfortable mattresses, and heated mirror in the bathroom (that prevented fogging). The rooms were clean and service was prompt and courteous. We didn't take the hotel breakfast: at 15 Euros and based on the hotel's own photographs in the elevators trying to sell it, the hotel breakfast was over-priced with far too few options; we ate around the corner for just a few Euros. The room was very warm; with the heat turned off we had to keep the small window open the entire time we were in the room … in January. (Other reviewers have had similar experiences.) If you want to sleep past sunrise be sure to bring your own sleep mask because the drapes do not block out the light even…

title: friendly staff but room needed more maintenance
review: Dear JB. We're so glad you chose Ayre Hotel Caspe to spend your days in this lovely city, and we appreciate your kind words. As I can observe, your impression about the hotel is not positive, but allow me to answer some issues; Buffet breakfast has an elevated production cost, and €15 (or €12 if you contract it for the whole stay) is a normal price in the city, but, as well, we have several offers for less than €4 at the caffeteria; about the curtains, all the rooms have 3 (three) layers, and one of them (middle one) is opaque, with the purpose of blocking the daylight, in the photo you submitted, I cannot define if it's extended or not. For all your technical mentions, I've already pass the proper note to maintenance dept. to take care about it, and we appreciate so much you advise us about it, we'll work on it ASAP. And about the hot tub, as we had a large amount of technical problems with them, we decided to close them for an indefined period of time, and retire from any website or similar to not to publicize it. Please don't hesitate in contacting us for any doubt or further information, we'll be glad to satisfy your requests. Yours, SocialMedia Manager - Ayre Hotel Caspe.

title: No complaints
review: stayed for 3 nights in January 2013.  the hotel located about 10 mins walk from Arch de Triumph station or Tetuan station.  there was a small supermarket and some local shops near by.  there were also many local restaurants.  The location was quiet and away from the main city centre but convenient enough to commute by metro.  we bought a 3 day travel card in airport that covered the journey between airport and hotel.   the hotel lobby was a simple modern design, bit cold but the reception staff were warm and friendly.  they were helpful and informative; they always gave us a big smile and said ola wherever we walked pass.  we called for help when we pressed the wrong button on the safe in room; the reception staff came immediately within one minute to our room to help us.  we…

title: Lovely stay
review: Dear Rebecca. We're do delighted you enjoyed your stay in the Hotel and this lovely city!!! Thank you for visiting us! We're so sorry about the opened water, we'll pass this info to the Housekeeper to take care about. The bottle opener is in the same furniture the fridge is; and we've plenty of local TV channels, and some foreign channels, we're planning to enlarge the list. We hope your next time here with us fulfill your expectations more than this time, and don't hesitate in contacting us for any doubt or future reservations, we'll be glad to satisfy all your requests. Yours, SocialMedia Manager - Ayre Hotel Caspe.

title: Average Hotel in Fabulous City.
review: We booked into this hotel for four nights.   The room (203) was clean, spacious and the beds were comfortable.    However, our room was so hot that we found sleeping almost impossible. We opened a small window to allow some air in, but unfortunately the noise from the street outside was torture too! .   We complained at least 5 times about it, and I now regret not requesting a room change.  We should have slept like babies, having walked the streets of beautiful Barcelona all day, but we were sleep deprived for our entire trip. We did not eat at the hotel, so don't know what the food was like.   There are lots of cafes nearby for drinks or coffees.   We felt very safe, the area is central to Placa Catalunya, The Rambla etc.  There is an abundance of fab restaurants in Barcelona…

title: not a very good choice
review: Dear Mrs. Irene, we're so delighted to had you in our hotel, and we appreciate so much your kind words. Unfortunatelly, not everything was happy during your stay, and that's our goal, making your stay something particular, filled of "little happy moments", and this wasn't your case. We don't have any maintenance order to #203 in that period, so we will "investigate" with more detail with our teams about your complaints. And let me comment, that our teams are always ready to offer a room change in this cases. Please don't hesitate in contacting us via social networks or e-mail for any suggestion or clearance! Thank you!!! SocialMedia Manager - Ayre Hotel Caspe.

title: Fabulous Find
review: Very good breakfast and polite staff The best for this hotel is the location. Between two metro stations, and very close to the center (placa de Catalunya) even walk Awful smell from the bathroom. Sunless and airless rooms. Overcharging the internet.

title: Perfect Location
review: Dear guest! Thank you for choosing our hotel for your stay in Barcelona. We are so glad to see our services and team are in the right way to satisfy our guests. By the other hand, we have been working on many parts of the hotel during this year, and it's possible that in the period you've been with us had problems with the bathrooms. We apololigize about this and hope you can contact us to give more details about this, to guarantee this won't happens again. Regarding the rooms, we have 141 rooms, and some of them are interior, it's only and architectural issue; and we provide free wi-fi to all our guests, unless they want more speed. We remain always at your entire service and availability to stay connected (via email, or social networks). Thank you! SocialMedia Manager - Ayre Hotel Caspe.

title: Excellent hotel
review: The Ayre Hotel Caspe is a terrific find in a city of expensive hotels.  Located just out of the most touristy areas but within walking distance of La Sagrada Familia, this modern, glass and chrome- decked delight is sure to please.  Rooms are functional and comfortable with intelligent furnishings.  Terrific shower with two heads!  Front desk staff couldn't have been more obliging or helpful, even helping secure and print out tickets online for the Sagrada - a must to avoid the long lines which snake around the block! Breakfast was only so-so:  coffee good, slow to refill hot dishes, pastries second-rate.   Parking right next to the hotel in an underground garage was so convenient:  just park it and leave it for the duration of the visit as public transport eg buses and taxis…

title: Modern living
review: The hotel was nice and modern looking. Room was quite small but still big enough for two people. Room was very clean and seemed to be good quality.   Staff was very friendly in the reception but unfortunately not everyone spoke English in the lobby par. We still managed to order what we liked. The staff in the reception was very friendly offering us a map of Barcelona and marking all the important locations as well as the nearest metro stops. It was also possible to buy tickets to Sagrada Familia through the hotel as you can skip the huge waiting queue at the location.  Lobby bar also has some food available but don't expect anything spectacular. Good food if you are in a hurry or don't want to go looking outside. Breakfast is quite expensive and you can get pretty much the same…

title: Great Hotel in lovely Barcelona
review: Thank you for all your kind words you gift us! I'm preety sure we will surprise you next time you visit us, please keep in touch with us to let us know when it will be!!! Next time you won't miss our menu breakfast for less than €4!!! THANK YOU!!!!

title: Clean modern hotel,friendly staff
review: Ayre Caspe is a very nice hotel in a very nice location in Barcelona. Neighborhood is silent but in a walking distance to Catalunya Square. Rooms are big enough with all required equipments and a nice bathroom. All parts of the hotel is very clean. Stuff is very friendly. Nothing is wrong with this hotel, stayed couple of times and would recommend it definitely!

title: Great hotel
review: This kind of comments encourage us to keep the way on! Thank you for coming, for returning and for your futures visits, of course!!! Please don't hesitate in contact us for anything you might need! THANK YOU!!!

title: A very clean and friendly hotel.
review: The foyer is very immaculate & modern as are the rooms, although my particular rooms view was a brick wall. The staff were very friendly and welcoming & spoke very good english.  Location is quiet, close to Segrada Familia but a decent 15 mins walk to the main shopping areas & restaurants. I suggest this type of hotel would be more suited for short stays (I stayed for 2 nights before a cruise) & for couples rather than families.

title: Nice atmosphere, very good value
review: I immediately felt comfortable at this hotel. The lobby has a soft, modern decor which creates a relaxed, calm atmosphere. On arrival the reception staff were polite and helpful.  The room was well decorated and very clean. The aircon was very efficient and almost silent which is unheard of. There was a nice large TV with a reasonable selection of English language news channels. All the promised room facilities existed and were in good working order. Despite seeing many other guests around the hotel I heard very little ambient noise and nothing from the adjoining rooms, which was lovely. Free wifi is available throughout the hotel and I had good signal in our room, the lobby and the bar. The gym is very basic, a token typical of most hotel gyms - a good selection of free weights…

title: short stay
review: Distinguished guest: We are speechless…this is what Ayre Hoteles tries to generate in our guests…comfort, front desk clerks help and availability, cleanliness, quietness and a real and transparent geographical situation. We will defininetly happy to see you again, so don't hesitate in contacting us at socialmedia.caspe@ayrehoteles.com to keep in touch with you. Greetings and many many thanks!

title: Starting to look a bit shabby
review: Very helpful staff. Very clean rooms but would have liked the ability to make tea/coffee.Linen changed daily but really not necessary. Food and drinks service  slow sometimes in cafe bar but pina coladas worth the wait!  Would have liked more selection from the menu in the cafe bar as there were few decent eating places in the area.

title: Great Say in Barcellona
review: Dear Guest: We appreciate so much your words, Ayre Hoteles put a big effort choosing the right personnel to give our guests the hospitality their deserve. Of course that we take note about your suggestions and they will be point of internal meetings. Don't hesitate in contact us at socialmedia.caspe@ayrehoteles.com to keep in touch with us. Thank you!

title: A nice hotel, on a so-so location... But worth the money
review: Decent price for a four star hotel, but parts of our room were looking a bit shop worn.  Our mistake was choosing this hotel instead of a better located one - either nearer the beach or closer to the main shopping area.  Housekeeping was perfect, and the breakfasts were fine too, as was the desk staff.  Tried to use the "gym" one morning at about 6:00 and learned that it didn't open until 9:00.  Not good timing for me.  Not likely we would re-book here.

title: Nice hotel for a nice price
review: Located in quiet surrondings, this hotel was more than ok for the price (ca 75 Euros for standard double room). The room were clean and nice, with a small safe for our valuables and a minibar with free water at arrival. The staff was helpful and polite. We did not try their breakfast buffet, and doubt that it was worth 15 Euros, but it is possible to just buy coffee and simple breakfast, like toast or yoghurt. Walking distance to several metro stops, and about a 15 minute stroll to plaza Catalunya. It is also possible to walk to the beach (30 min) and other good parts of the city. The area around the hotel was not of interest to us, but it is possible to find cafes with decent coffee and local pastries. We felt safe walking in the neighborhood by night, and it is really not that…

title: Nice hotel.
review: We stayed here for 5 days in August 2012. We took a taxi from the airport, this took about 30 minutes. The taxis use meters however it is useful to note that a supplement is charged for travel from the cruise terminal, train station and airport. A supplement for luggage is also charged. The supplement is added at the end of the trip so be aware that you won't necessarily pay what is displayed on the meter. The pricing structure should be displayed in the taxi. The cost from El Prat to the hotel was approximately €30.  The nearest metro stations are Tetuan and Arc de Triumf. These are roughly 5-10 minutes walk.  Le sagrada familia is approximately 15 minutes walk, las ramblas is approximately 20 minutes walk.  The hotel rooms are nicely presented, with plenty of room for luggage.…

title: For the price and the location it was a good choice for us
review: We had 2 showers on our room, that was interesting.  The room was clean enough, but they need to work a bit on the maintenance and repaint and shine things more often.   We  had plenty of room to put our two large bags and also closet space. Nice amenities, including a pad to clean your shoes.   Towels were a bit old but not broken, just not too white. We got 4 small bottles of water free in the mini refrigerator.  No kettle but if you get up really early there is some terrible free coffee in the lobby.  Front desk was polite and helpful.  Free wi-fi in the room.  Several news channels in English.  Breakfast was not worth the price.

title: Excellent Hotel
review: We have just returned from a 2 night weekend break to Barcelona, and the Hotel is brilliant. The location is ideal for getting around, we travelled to the hotel from the airport via the train then underground. I had emailed the hotel beforehand and they provided excellent detailed directions.  The staff were very helpful, nothing was too much trouble, on the last day we were able to use the showers in the gym to shower and change before our flight.  The room was clean and modern, with a fridge with complimentary water, although no tea & coffee making facilities. I am normally quite a light sleeper, but had no problem sleeping, considering that the hotel was full, there was no noise at all.  We only had breakfast on the first morning, which I feel was overpriced with not a great…

title: Really Good
review: Perfect location, within walking distance of Catalunya and a 5-7 minute cab ride to the beach. Staff are really friendly and helped with recommendations, directions etc.. The room itself was well maintained and with the exception of tea/coffee making facility, well equipped (isn't much of an issue as loads of cafe's etc. within couple minutes of the hotel). Overall a very pleasant stay. Cant wait to get back!

title: Fantasic Hotel and Staff
review: We stayed at this hotel for a week and had a very plesant stay.  We had a room on the 7th floor.  The room was clean and modern and sound insulated.  However you do hear sounds from people walking by your door.  There was a small fridge in the room, plenty of storage for your clothes, free wifi (uid and password provided at checkin), a window with black out curtains and a safe.  The safe did not fit our 15.4 inch laptop properly.  We had to place the laptop in there diagonally and prop it up with some of our clothing so that the safe door would close.  The one thing that was lacking from the room was an iron which we did not need during our visit.  The hotel staff were wonderful and extremely helpful from providing us with directions, maps and ensuring that all our needs were…

title: great hotel
review: We've stayed there 4 nights. Hotel is very nice and cozy. There is little fridge in the room, hair dryer, soaps, shower gels etc even combe :))) . Staff is brilliant, they will help you with everything, and they are very nice and polite. We've hired bikes and visited almost everytking in barcelona within 5 days. Would very much recomend this hotel and if we are back in Barcelona it will be Ayre Hotel. Plus is very cheap :))

title: Perfect location and great hotel.
review: I'd never visited Barcelona before so choosing an area and hotel was down to luck, which turned out to be good! The location of the Ayre Caspe is only a few minutes from Arc de Triomf or Tetuan metro stations so getting anywhere was very easy for us. The Eixample region around the hotel is packed with small bars and restaurants which are all very cheap and you can walk a few blocks to many of the main attractions, such as La Pedrera, Sagrada Familia and Parc de la Cuitadella if you want to stretch your legs. I'm not a fan of busy areas, tacky tourist spots or having to fight for a bar seat with crowds of Brits and this is certainly not a problem in the region of the hotel.  The hotel itself was clean, cool and modern. Our room was lovely and spacious with air conditioning which…

title: Excellent!!
review: Just back from a 3 night stay at the Ayre Hotel Caspe, and we can't wait to return.  The hotel is in an excellent position for the La Segrada Familia ( book online tickets for this as the que is huge and can take almost 3hrs to get in!)  and Las Ramblas, both only 15mins walk away.  Many coffee shops etc. close to hotel.  We took the breakfast option at the hotel and it is very good value, well worth it. Didn't use the restaurant in the evenings, we were out from 9am till late.  The reception staff are wonderful, they are so helpful, informative and extremly pleasant, the best we've had.  The room was lovely, beds a little hard, but a very peaceful nights sleep!  Taxi from Las Ramblas to hotel is around 5E, worth it if your down there late at night with tired legs. Thanks to all…

title: Great Hotel in the heart of Barcelona
review: We were very pleased with our stay at Ayre Hotel Caspe.  The rates were very reasonable - about $120/nite.  It was in a great location - about 2 miles from Las Ramles and a mile from La Sagrada Familia.  The walks to both were full of amazing architecture.  There were a number of  coffee shops and bakerys within blocks and the hotel actually had a restaurant but the menu was pretty basic.  I would not opt for the breakfast inclusion in the room rate because there were so many great places nearby to eat breakfast for much less.  The staff was wonderful, very helpful and accomadating.  There was not much of a view from the rooms - in fact, my sister's room looked out onto the hotel lobby atrium, but we weren't there for what we could see from our room.  A wonderful experience.

title: Great staff, decent location
review: Received a really friendly, informative welcome at the hotel.  Staff were very helpful with directions and general tourist information.  Room was spacious and comfortable. Not too far of a walk to sights -  Arc de Triomf approx 10 min walk away, Sagrada Familia approx 15 mins walk and there are a couple of metro stations in easy walking distance so it was quite easy to get around.  Very pleasant stay.

title: Nice Hotel
review: Stayed in the hotel with my mother during the weekend break in Barcelona. It took as a while to find it as we didn't know the street, but eventualy realized that it's only 15 min walking distance again from the main city centre. Didn't used restaurant as there are plenty of small resaturants and pastry shops around the hotel. Also it's very easy to catch train or bus around the area. Hotel rooms are very comfy and nice looking, as well as the main lobby. The gym facility with the sauna and spa would need some updates though. Reception staff was super friendly and helpful. Especially Xavier made me laugh a lot. Would definatly stay in this hotel on my next visit to Barcelona.

title: Bathroom mold
review: The first room had no windows and the bathroom had a lots of mold = the room stank. After complaint, we got a better room. In general, the location is within walking distance from the city center and breakfast is also good. I would however consider twice before staying in this hotel again.

title: Fantastic in all areas
review: Distinguished guest, thank you for choosing Ayre Hoteles for your stay in Barcelona, and to appreciate the quality of our products. Our front desk staff is always open to solve any issues with all our comprehension, specially when our guests are not as happy as the wish to be. In any case, please contact us at caspe@ayrehoteles.com to follow this with more accuracy. Thank you!

title: Loved this hotel
review: Though I read through mounds and mounds of online reviews to make a decision, I never really make them - This time I feel inclined to do so because of the fantastic experience we had!  Room was really large, spacious and importantly - Superbly bright. Brightness can really enhance the space in a room and it was a breath of fresh air from the normal smaller sizes you tend to get in European city centres. The man who greeted us on arrival was ace (aside from looking like Robin Van Persie - haha!), gave directions to the best places to go etc. Bath AND shower was a nice touch and again added to the spacious feel of the room. Perhaps the cleanest looking hotel we've ever stayed in. Fridge inclusion was great and though the wifi wasn't very fast where we were, it is an EXTRA service…

title: great hotel service and location
review: this was our 3rd stay at ayre caspe hotel in Barcelona- my husband loves this hotel and he is right- 10 minutes walk from passeig del garcia - and you arrive to this modern efficient hotel where the staff is efficient and helpful and the rooms are clean and modern- you don't need anything else!

title: Nice quiet hotel, good location
review: We are glad to recieve this kind of nice words. Returning to us show that our efforts to fulfill with our guest's happiness and expectations are in the good path. Ayre Hotel Caspe will be so proud to guest you once more in the near future, just contact us anytime. Don't hesitate to give us any suggestion to improve our service. Thank you for choosing Ayre Hoteles!

title: Pretty generic hotel off the beaten path- excellent customer service
review: Stayed for 3 nights in June.  Clean, modern hotel. No problems.  Staff very efficient and helpful.  Very comfortable beds; bathroom modern and efficient. €15 Euro breakfast was all you can eat but should ask for freshly cooked eggs.  We preferred the Express breakfast for €4 including coffee, orange juice and croissant.  Took about 10 mins to walk to La Sagrada Famillia and 10 minutes in other direction to main square at top of the Ramblas to catch the City tour bus and the shops.  Metro station just few minutes away and very easy to get down to Barceloneta and the beach. It was nice being just above the busy part of town.  Got a brilliant deal on lastminute.com which included flights with BA.

title: Great location, great price
review: Thank you for choosing Ayre Hoteles for your stay in Barcelona. We appreciate all your comments and as we're always looking for our guest complete satisfaction, so we're open to recieve any kind fo suggestion and comment, just write to us at caspe@ayrehoteles.com. We'll be looking forward to guest you next time!

title: Very nice city hotel with a great location
review: We stayed at the Ayre Hotel Caspe for one night in June. It's a bit of a walk to the main drag in Barcelona (about 20 minutes from the Ramblas), but also a lovely, quiet location in the Eixample neighborhood. The hotel itself is pretty generic; modern, small rooms, big buffet breakfast (15 euros pp), but the guys at the front desk were great. They were all very helpful and accommodating, and helped us order and print tickets for the Sagrada Familia, which saved a ton of time at the cathedral!

title: Good value yet pay attention to the location
review: We stayed here with 5 friends in May 2012. Staff was helpful and kind. Rooms were clean and there was everything we needed. The rooms were quiet and the bed was comfortable.  The only issue was the location, it was a bit far off from e.g. Rambla and beach yet it didn't take a long time to walk there, 15- 20min. On the positive note Sagrada Familia was close. Other positive note was that just few blocks to east was Mango's outlet store.

title: Good value
review: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in May. I chose this hotel for its location based on some of the reviews I read. It is quite central and within walking distance to the main core and near to 2 subway lines. However, after having been there a couple of days I did find the 15 to 20 minute walk from Catalunya a bit tiring after having been on our feet all day. The subway (metro) is a 10 minute walk to either of the stations.  The service was friendly and the staff very accommodating.  We opted to take a room that included breakfast which was sufficient to keep us going to mid afternoon tapas. They will cook eggs to order if requested. However, from other reviews I see that a la carte they charge 12 euro per person which is a little expensive for what they offer. Within a stones…

title: close to La Sagrada Familia
review: I stayed for 3 nights in Hotel Caspe while on a trip with 3 friends.  We thought the hotel was a great bargain, very spacious for a European hotel, clean and modern.  The beds were comfortable, and the shower had a door (not always present in European hotel rooms, don't ask me why).  It is close to Sagrada Familia, but a little far from the city center if you want to walk.  However, there is a metro stop a couple blocks away that will take you where you want to go.  The plus side to being outside of the city center is that it was very quiet at night (no drunks singing or shouting outside).

title: Spacious, quiet, well appointed and decorated
review: This hotel is about a  20 minute walk from Plaza Catalunya, (right near La Rambla) 20 minutes from Sagrada Familia and about 15 minutes from the Arc d Triomphe. Near everything you need but in a quiet area with large quiet rooms. Perfect for an after cruise stay. 5 minutes from a bus stop and train station. Really easy to get into the heart of the city via public transportation or walking.  The front desk staff is very friendly and helpful, the rooms are clean, well appointed, large and quiet. Flat screen TV, plenty of closet space. The beds weren't as comfortable as I'd hoped, but all in all no complaints. Large bathroom with a shower, and a bath shower combo.  There's a small restaurant on site as well as bar. Plenty of food choices in the area as well as a grocery store.…

title: Overall good experience
review: We booked this hotel through lastminute.com - so weren't sure what to expect. We were pleasantly surprised by the hotel. The room was clean, had a tv (with BBC world), and had a modern bathroom with separate walk-in shower and bath. On the downside, the room's windows looked into the lobby which meant the room was dark and we couldn't open the window. The air con was a bit fiddly but once we got it working it was fine. The staff were helpful and friendly. The location was central and most tourist sites were easy walking distance. The computers in the lobby were really expensive to use (I think it was about 5 euro an hour) with slow internet and on old machines - which was disappointing. Overall I would recommend this hotel for a short visit to Barcelona, but would ask for a room…

title: Nice, clean, modern
review: Fairly modest accommodation, small but comfortable room, modern bathroom.  The hotel is in a good location for the subway and city bus lines, between the Born/Barri Gotic areas and Sagrada Familia - easy walking to those areas.

title: Nice staff.. But 3* not 4*
review: Just returned, the location was good. It was overpriced, the rooms were comfortable but very basic. It was no more splendid than an ibis. The staff were good and so was the shower! I would not stay there again given the competition.

title: Quiet but near the triangle
review: I stayed in this hotel four nights during august. The city was crowded. It looked like every single italian was in vacation in Barcelona at the same time.  Despite the caos, I enjoed the Ayre Hotel Caspe. The cool design makes it quite posh and although collocated in a peaceful neighbourhood (there is a fine pastry shop just across the street and two or three mini markets) you can reach the triangle in 10 minutes by foot. It is also near enough to the underground and that allows you to visit the whole city saving a lot of time. I totally recommend Barcelona because you can't leave this city without a smile on your face I also recommend this hotel, it's the best quality/price ratio.

title: Recommended
review: Very modern hoel. Close to metro station and to Sagrada Familia. Very friendly staff and very comfy room.

title: Great Hotel - Good Value and Friendly Welcome
review: Stayed in the Ayre Hotel Caspe for 3 nights including breakfast, modern friendly hotel within easy walking distance of all main attractions. Friendly staff, good breakfast and reasonable modern rooms, It is a reasonable walk from Catalunya Sq but not too bad. Would definitely recommend as a good price for what is a good hotel.

title: rooms not up to spec for a 4 star hotel; location excellent
review: We stayed for a long weekend and had to move room 3 times because things were not working in each romm offered : 1) WIFI, 2) heating 3) window jammed broken, 4) fridge broken and making loud noise. There was also some mold in each of the showers in the rooms. The staff were quite accommodating and offered us a new room for every night. The location is excellent with lots of sight seeing and restaurants within walking distance. The Himalyian restaurant directly across from the Hotel is excellent if you like authenic indidan food.

title: Hard beds...
review: A friend of mine and I spent 7 nights in this hotel. We booked via "Lastminutes" and found a very good price. I sent an e-mail before going about a non-smoking room and twin beds, I had an answer, and when w arrived, that's what we found. Our room was at the 7th floor. The people working at the reception were nice and the two girls at the bar where we took most of our breakfasts and some of our dinners were very nice, patients and doing their best even if we didn't really speak spanish (and one of them wasn't really speaking english either !). The room was nice, big enough, nice big bathroom (italian shower AND bath), everything very clean, shampoo and everything everyday. The walls are not very big, but we didn't suffer with the noise at all (except some mornings when the maids…

title: Short stay
review: My wife and I went with another couple to celebrate his 50th and the 6th anniversary of when I first met my wife. We were very staisfied apart from their room reeking of tobacco smoke. They made a good job of decorating our breakfast table. One tip is to ask at reception for them to mark the position of the hotel on a map since the streets are very similar.

title: Very satisfied
review: I thoroughly recommend this hotel for all travellers, I stayed here for 2 nights over a weekend in February 2012 and couldn't have been happier with the experience, especially given that I paid just €50 per night.  Overall my experience was very positive - I would stay here again and I would also recommend the hotel to others.  The standard of the room was quite high, featuring both a stand-up shower and a separate shower/bath combo.  The entire hotel seemed very modern and clean, while the attitudes of the hotel staff I encountered at check-in and check-out were extremely positive - they were very keen to help in any way they could.  I had the impression of a group of people who are very focused on the guests, which is unlike some of my experiences in other hotels in Spain. …

title: Very nice hotel
review: This is a nice, modern, clean hotel in Barcelona.  Stayed for 3 days in November 2011. The rooms were clean and modern, and I was not bothered by street noise.  The location is a bit ?West of the city, west of the Arc de Triomf, and a 15-20 minute walk from Las Ramblas.  It's in a nice residential type area. You can get into the old part of the city adjacent to Las Ramblas very easily.  Room had safe, free internet (that worked relatively well), a fridge, and of course LCD TV with cable.  Great base for exploring the city, if you do not want to be on the busiest street in the city! Also, great price!

title: Great value
review: I stayed at the Ayre Caspe for 8 days over Christmas.  The hotel is a great value.  It's modern, clean, and reasonably quiet.  The staff have all been kind and helpful.  It's located in a more residential area, but within easy walking distance to the main sights.  The free internet worked well enough in the rooms and very well in the lobby.  The bathroom has a tub and shower, which was nice- and unusual in Europe in my experience.     It's not a fancy place- more Ikea than the Ritz- but perfectly comfortable with a lovely staff and a reasonable price.  I'd certainly stay here again.

title: Excellent value
review: Modern furnishings, good size for Barcelona, small fridge in the room, air conditioning working fine, good location, close to the subway and 15 minutes walking from downtown. And reasonable priced for Barcelona as well.

title: Definite Recommendation
review: We stayed here in October 2011, and would definitely stay again.  The hotel was clean, modern and attractive and lovely and quiet at night. The bedrooms were a really good size, and the bathroom had wet-room shower AND a bath with a shower as well.  The staff were all friendly and helpful, even though the extent of our Spanish was by way of a phrase book that we had bought two days previously!   The breakfasts were fantastic.  Lots of time allowed and plenty of choice for food and drink - even Cava!  We were lucky as breakfast was included in our holiday package, but would have cost us 15 euros each otherwise.  We ate in the hotel bar on a couple of evenings, and the prices were certainly reasonable.  Wine is good value at 2 euros a glass and tastes good as well - not cheap…

title: would recommend
review: A pleasant modern hotel with uncluttered attractive bedrooms.  The room we had was nice and quiet and the breakfasts good.  One draw back was the double bed in  adapted bedrooms - surely twin would have been more flexible to everyones needs?  The adapted bathroom was well thought out.  The staff were helpful and friendly and drinks prices were acceptable.  Although I though the rooms were attractive I have only marked it 3 instead of 5 because of the problem with the adapted room.

title: Good solid comfortable hotel
review: A modern, fairly small hotel that did everything we wanted for a short visit to Barcelona.  The lobby and rooms were modern and comfortable, staff were very friendly, spoke excellent english (which is good as our Spanish is terrible!), and very helpful.  It is located between Playa de Catulunya and Sagri de Familia, so not that close to Las Ramblas (15min walk), but it is close to the Metro Train, so easy to get around.

title: Very pleasant stay
review: We stayed at this hotel in september 2011, the staff was very friendly, answering all our questions with a smile. The room was plenty big with 2 large beds (although a single bed would have been nicer).  Both a shower and a (small) bath were available in the bathroom.  Breakfast was quite expensive: 15€ per person, per day. Although it would be discounted to 12€ if we'd order the breakfast for the entire stay during check-in. Instead we looked for a nice local place to have breakfast (exit the hotel to the right and walk 4 or 5 blocks).  The biggest downside was with our room: it was located pretty close to the lobby which meant that a couple of days we were awoken because a large group of people had gathered there before going to town.  This hotel was located outside the busy…

title: Decent and clean, but not super
review: Room: We stayed for 2 nights in this hotel and booked 2 rooms. A regular double room and a room for 3 persons, which was the same room with an extra smaller bed. The room was big enough and had a very clean and spateous bathroom! The airco was great and silent and was very welcome when it is 31 degrees Celsius in mid septembre. Also the hotel staff was very friendly and offers to help you at all times.  Food: Breakfast was rather poor: a lot of empty plates, not always enough cups for coffee and only some pastries to choose from. If you are looking for restaurants or pubs, you better look for another place as there is nothing much here.  Location: The location is also not ideal, but okay. A 5 minute walk takes you to the Metro station at Plaça Tetuan, from where you can easily…

title: Good, with a few not-goods
review: We arranged a package including air and hotel.  The hotel was very welcoming with a modern lobby.  The location is quite good, safe and within access of many areas to shop and roam.  The room was comfortable, but after the second night, we noticed bug bites.  Now, as a nurse, I recognize that 2-3 bites in rows usually means bed bugs.  I went to the front desk and the desk clerk insisted that they were mosquito bites.  It took another day (which was our last in Barcelona) before getting a new room.  We checked the mattresses out  very well and had a good night's sleep.

title: Very good experience at the Caspe in Barcelona
review: My family (wife, 20-year old son and myself) spent 5 nights in mid-August at the Caspe. It is a modern and solid 4-star hotel. We were given a triple-room, facing a quiet yet sunny back patio. The space was very adequate (not enormous, but not tiny a la London, either) for the three of us. The bathroom was quite modern with separate tub and glass-enclosed shower (the water pressure in the shower was memorable!), all beds were quite solid (as we like them, although some people could find them too hard), and the in-room safe deposit box could comfortably accommodate a laptop computer. Very clean, rooms were serviced satisfactorily every day. The desk staff were very correct and corteous without becoming annoyingly obsequious. Although the reception desk seemed to always have…

title: Can't wait to go back!
review: This hotel was randomly selected after reading so many reviews I couldn't keep them straight. It's only a couple blocks from the metro and pretty central to many things if you'd rather see Barcelona by walking. To me, it was the better way to experience the city, rather than taking the metro everywhere.  The hotel was clean and modern. My room had hardwood floors and a walk in shower and separate bath tub. Every night I was woken up by some noise, either a struggling AC or rusty pipes, but I didn't let it bother me because it wasn't worth it. The bed was so comfortable I didn't want to get up.   As a single female traveler, the area was quiet and I wasn't bothered at all, no matter what time of the day or night I was out. The area is residential and I found a couple grocery…

title: Very nice place to stay that is off the tourist path
review: Had a great stay here: ten days total, staff was somewhat helpful (weakest part of the hotel), room was HUGE and comfortable and very clean, cleaning staff excellent, breakfast was average, bartender was very good with wine selections of Spain, location was great- three blocks from the bus stop to the beacses, three blocks from Sagrada Familia (best site in Barcelona!) six blocks from Arc de triumph, and nine blocks from the major tourist area (La Rambla), quiet area of town with some small eating joints but no shopping. Would definitely stay here again. Booked thru Orbitz so the room was paid for before we arrived, highly suggest this process so there is no dispute with the charge.

title: Great place to discover Barca
review: Great hotel, a bit out of the centre and (I think) mainly a business-people place. But in quiet times, you can often find a good deal here. At walking distance of the Sagrada Familia and the Arc de Triomphe, so not so far out of the way. Bike rental close to the hotel, great way to discover the city !! Nice breakfast, good choice.

title: Gorgeous, modern hotel... great service and good location
review: We received outstanding service from the entire staff at the hotel during our  stay. The manager (Xavier) was especially helpful in giving us recommendations as well as get us in contact with local service providers (guided tours, bike rentals, ...). Our room was clean, comfortable and includes a good wifi connection. The hotel has plenty of shops / restaurants nearby as well.

title: Okay hotel in good location.
review: The hotel location is pretty good. I read some reviews saying it is not in a good part of the City, and while it is located in a relatively quiet area, I never felt unsafe even walking back to the hotel late at night.  The hotel is within walking distance to the main tourist attractions. I walked everywhere and never needed to rely on public transport (which was preferable as I did not want to deal with the notorious pickpocketers on the Metro).  The room was small but are comfortable. My only complaints about this hotel is that the shower tiles were clearly very old and looked dirty. In addition, I asked reception for an iron to press a shirt (which was quite wrinkled from being in my suitcase) and she said they do not offer this - the only option was to send this to an…

title: Nice hotel, ok location
review: Hotel is situated centrally in Barcelona with waling distance to La Sagrada Familia and the old city. When I arrived a pleasant man in the reception with perfect English told me I was to early to check in (10 am). But he would make arrangements for me to have a room in 30 min. The room was spacious, clean and with both shower and bathtub. I struggled somewhat to get the Wifi working due to a less than intuitive login feature. The smell from the shower was not very nice (smelled like sewage). All in all a good hotel.

title: Good hotel, great location and top value!
review: The Ayre Caspe hotel is a quality hotel in a great location in Barcelona. It is under a mile to all the major locations and the staff were generally good. One, Jordi, was really helpful and friendly. One of the others was not as helpful and seemed more occupied with a personal call rather than checking us in.   Anyway, the room was nice and clean and the facilities are good although the gym is a but small and the water dispenser did not work. The offer of free water and wifi only applied to water on the first day and the wifi signal was poor. Apart from that everyone was nice and helpful and the room was kept clean throughout our week stay. Overall a good hotel and a pleasant stay. Would stay there again and would recommend particularlyto those on a budget as it is great value.

title: Overall Great hotel, Great people and value
review: -main/only problem: Internet was a pain and a hassle despite the promise of wireless access, the system was usually down, and the public machines were slow and difficult.  this was a problem for contacting people and checking flight times.  - also there were lights that didn't work  - otherwise the place is fresh and modern and relatively easy to access.  general location was a bit removed from the central parts of the city, but it was fine

title: Great value for great hotel!
review: The hotel is fantastic: spotless, very large room, beautiful bathroom with all you need, and an extremely friendly staff. Would certainly recomend for everyone, it is for sure the best price/quality in Barcelona. The location is also great (next to metro), the main hall is a piece of art, and the fares are unbeatable.

title: Great hotel, just not for us
review: We checked in on the 4th of June and stayed for six nights. We arrived at around 10am, and a friendly reception lady checked us in. We were greeted by her warmly. As we arrived quite early, so we had to wait for about 40 minutes in the lobby before we could resign to our rooms. The lobby design is very minimalist and feels quite lifeless and uninviting. Nonetheless it was brightened up by the first day’s hotels receptionists.   Hotel was clean and superb, but one thing they do not provide is a kettle/flask. It is troublesome if you want to make a hot drink, because you have to call the room service for it. On one of the nights, we had to go down to the cafeteria to fetch the flask of hot water ourselves. The cafeteria was actually quite empty except for one customer, and yet we…

title: Fantastic staff and comfortable rooms
review: I Just loved this hotel and will be staying again, it's location is great, it's not on any busy tourist streets so it's nice and quite but is a short walk from Sagrada Familia.
