The hotel decor is probably not for everyone but I really liked how unusual the lobby was, I loved the light fixture.   The rooms were really comfortable, quite large for a city hotel and spotlessly clean. I went with 3 of my friends and one got sick and both her and her boyfriend were well looked after for the rest of the trip, which brings me around to staff  While all the staff were helpful there was a bar man in the bar who just stole the show (I got his name but since it's so long ago since our trip I have forgotten it) He was by far the greatest Sangria maker in all of Spain (I have drank my fair…

title: Great choice- definately will go back
review: After a one night stay at the Ayre Rossellon at another part of Barcelona, we knew we wouldn't be dissapointed. Modern, clean, staff very helpfull, and bearing in mind the standard of the hotel and the surroundings, i was shocked at the value of the drinks, glass of house white wine- 2euro!! Which meant that it was nice to spend time in the hotel and not just as a base for crashing at the end of a long day, 10 minute walk from the hotel is catalonia square, fab for shopping great atmosphere and a huge Hard Rock cafe, which means there is a back-up for people who may not enjoy spanish food, or a break from all the tapas. there is a supermarket next door with the cheapest fruit and wine which is great to save on costs if you want to take a picnic out anywhere. already looking at…

title: Great Hotel, OK location
review: This is a great hotel, but in an OK location.  We stayed two nights at this property in early April and got a great deal on the price.  The rooms are of decent size and the beds are comfortable.  There is a refrigerator in the room and it is stocked daily with water (both with and without gas).  The bathroom is ample size with both a shower and a tub.    There are a few restaurants close to the hotel.  We tried a cheap tapas place across the street (next to the coffee shop).  It had really cheap food and the quality fit the price.  We ate when we were in the tourist areas before we got back to the hotel.  I would have given this hotel a 5/5 if it were in a better location.  It is approximately 15 minutes walking from Sagrada Familia (absolutely beautiful inside) and about 10…

title: One of the best
review: I have just returned from Barcelona and I stayed at the Hotel Ayre Caspe. The hotel was all you could ask for and I slept very well. We arrived early and the hotel let us into our room without us even asking. The staff were helpful and attentive. The hotel is based in a quieter area but only a few minutes walk will take you to some lovely sights. The rooms were clean and tidy. I found the beds to be one of the most comfortable I have slept in. All in all you can't go wrong with this hotel.

title: Quite good rooms
review: Hotel is located in quiet area with a lack of shops and tapas bar, but you have to walk 15 minutes and you are on the Catalunia place. Breakfest are expensive, romms are very clean and good equipment. Every day you have few bottels of normal water and soda. There are rooms inside building which have no outside window only window to the main hall.

title: Awesome, will definitely go back!
review: I met up with my girlfriend in Barcelona last year and this hotel was the first place we stayed.  It was a great price and I was impressed with the service, the quality of rooms and the cleanliness. It was extremely clean, the beds were big and comfortable, big windows overlooking the street. Not that hard to get to(near Tetuhuan station) In fact we are going back to Barcelona this September and my girlfriend and I want to go back to this same hotel. It was quick to check in and the staff treated us extremely well. Although the location is about a 10 -15 minute walk from Plaza Catalunya it is not that far and a short walk from Parque Ciutadela. You can also take the metro quickly anywhere. I would highly recommend this hotel and wish we would have booked more nights there the…

title: Christmas market -La Fira Llucia
review: A modern lobby gives quite a cold impression as you enter from the street, but the hotel is clean and comfortable and also very quiet.  The food is very basic, although of good quality. In the evening,a cafeteria is available but no restaurant. Some simple meals are available, steak & chips, pasta & sauce, chicken breasts & rice etc. Breakfast was mostly cold, although some simple hot food eggs etc was available on request.Some staff were a little distant, but individuals were friendly. A 20 minute walk to Plaza Catalunya a little less to Segrada Familia. The hotel feels a little souless but it was good as  a base to expolore central Barcelona.

title: Great hotel good location great neighborhood
review: We stayed at the Ayre on a Sat night , Nov 6th,  Got in early with early flight from US,  They let us in early and were extremely friendly and service oriented.  Room was typical small European, modern design. Neighborhood was good,,, 15 min walk to Rambla and Old town. Near cental square and bus terminal.  Didn't do metro but we were near metro stop.  Took bus from airport and walked to hotel... maybe should have taken cab.  Didn't have breakfast at hotel (seemed expensive) but found fantastic coffee shop 1/2 block away that was great.  Real authentic, all neighborhood people having coffee after church,,, great pastries and coffee. We loved it and would highly recommend it.  Went to great restaurant in Old town called Los Caracoles,,, another great local find . Another high…

title: Modern, clean, quiet, with all expected amenities
review: I was wary when it came to travelling to Barcelona, my first trip ever to Spain. But from the moment I stepped on Catalan soil at the airport, I realized I had it all wrong. Terminal one is simply the most beautiful, most convenient I have ever seen. Taxis are readily available and reliable. While I expected the worst, I must say that traffic laws are well obeyed and driving in Barcelona is relaxed. The city looks somewhat like a milder climate Zürich: lots of tree lined streets and avenues, ultra clean and green environment, efficient transit system. + architecture is mesmerizingly beautiful and the locals are rather friendly and easygoing. Hotel Ayre Caspe is perfectly in line with this description of the city. a nice modern, clean, quiet hotel with excellent service and a…

title: Nice hotel gr8 location for Sagrada familia
review: Hi, booked this hotel after lots of research gr8 price for 3 nights at lastminute. Easy to find as barcelona is one of best cities. Walking distance indian restaurant mayura nice indian food bit expensive though. walking distance sagrada familia. rooms are gr8 spacious and excellent service jus one thing no english channels in rooms quite frustrating . rest of it was gr8 excellent for the price i got it.

title: Location pretty good, Rooms reasonable, breakfast not all that
review: We stayed in this hotel 2 nights for a shopping trip to Barcelona. Though it was about 1Km from Passeig de Gracia (or 2 metro stops, with metro stop at about 300m from the hotel), location is in a residential area, which makes it safe.  The first night we were however not happy with our room... We were given a room specially designed for a disabled person, without bath. After complaining about this, we were however offered a normal room for the second night. This was clean, about 12m², with a separate shower in the bathroom, and a desk behind the bed. Breakfast is reasonable, with good choice, but the room has a rather clinic-feel about is. Conclusion: good hotel is you need one near a metro stop, near Gran Via, and not far from Parc de la Ciutadella. Price is not cheap, but…

title: Nice Hotel
review: The hotel was nice but kind of unremarkable. Clean room, good price, okay location. What really made the hotel great for us was that they let us check into our room at 7:30 am the day of our arrival. We had flown in from Canada and were tired and weary and expected to have to just store our luggage while we waited for our room. But the front desk clerk said the room was ready and we could check in despite the early time. This was very much appreciated. There wasn't a lot in the near vicinity of the hotel but it was only a 20 minute walk to La Rambla and the metro was nearby. Wireless internet was free but as we found in other hotels in Spain, it was unreliable. Fitness centre only had two or three cardio machines in a dark, little room and the sauna was out of order.

title: Female solo traveler
review: The hotel is OK, quiet and clean. The location is not bad, however there are other hotels at a similar distance to the central part of Barcelona that you can find at a better price. I personally wasn't very happy with the walking distance to Las Ramblas or Passeig de Gracia which were not less than 20 min of intense walking away. There were not many homeless people in the area (which seems to be a problem for Barcelona), however I found out that you can see them just about everywhere, so it is inevitable to run into one. One guy was sleeping in the entrance of the bank just opposite the hotel... So here are the pros and cons: Pros:  - Clean room, spacious and modern. - My room wasn't on the street, so it was pretty quiet, though you could clearly hear people talking in the…

title: Very nice!
review: Stayed in this hotel for 3 days while in Barcelona.  Room was a little small, but it was very modern.  Only complaint is that it was a little out of the way from the sights.... didn't really bother us much though!! Great hotel!

title: Great hotel
review: Hotel is about 5 blocks from the Rambles and 1 from the metro.  In a quire street but with in 10 mins of centre.  The room was a good size and with a shower over the bath and a walk in shower.  You got free wi-fi in the room and free bottled water. The breakfast was good and the staff very helpful I would definately recommend it

title: Good value,great location!
review: We stayed for 5 days in August-a period in which Barcelona is very crowdy.The room was very small but very peaceful and the bed was great-ask for a room in the interior of the hotel.The breakfast though was rather poor.But I would strongly recommend this hotel for people between 30-45, who planned a busy trip to Barcelona running all day around and needing a gret place to rest and sleep at night!

title: price / quality hotel in a quiet location
review: We booked this hotel via Internet (106 €/night - breakfast included) and had a very pleasant stay in February (2010). Staff was very fiendly and helpful. The hotel has a modern and trendy style and is located in a quiet neighbourhood, metro is two blocks away or you can walk to Placa Catalunya (10-15 minutes). Breakfastbuffet was very good. The only negative thing we experienced was the hardness of the bed.

title: Good quality hotel
review: Stayed for 4 nights in Sept 2010.   Upon arrival had a choice of a room with an exterior window but two single beds, or a room with an interior window and a king sized bed.  We chose the latter which proved to be quite a large room and the lack of a window wasn't a problem.  Clean room, great bathroom and a very comfortable, albeit firm, bed.  The soundproofing isn't up to much but we were so tired from all the walking we did/the heat that it didn't really matter. It takes almost 20 minutes to walk to Las Ramblas and the nearest metro station is about less than a 10 minute walk. Staff very helpful and the 4 members of reception staff we met were very helpful.  We didn't use any of the hotel facilites. We made our return journey to the hotel/airport via the train and metro as we…

title: Good,Clean and Slient Hotel
review: We had made our booking on internet and they welcome us polite, we have couple room and room was big but our window not looking to out side of the hotel. Bath was perfect it has 1 shower and 1 bathtub.Location is not perfect but good its 15 min far from Plaça de Catalunya by walking, but 3 mins away you can see the metro station. its 2 or 3 minits far to Plaça de Catalunya by metro. Infront of the hotel thare is a litle market. Wather is free at rooms.

title: Very satisfied
review: Stayed at Ayre Hotel with my family. This was our first time in Barcelona. We found the hotel to be a great value. The staff was helpful, courteous, and always available. The rooms are large (by European standards) and comfortable. The Metro is near by and top sites are a short ride away. The breakfast was excellent. Wifi connection was reliable.

title: Very Nice
review: Very nice hotel, rooms with a clean and modern decor, bathroom with 2 showers. Good location near Sagrada Familia and metro. Nice neighborhood.

title: Nice, comfortable and good value for money
review: I must say I found some of the reviews for this hotel a little harsh, we found this hotel to tick all the boxes for a good value for money hotel.  The rooms are large and provide everything that you need.  The bathrooms are also large in comparison to many hotels we have stayed in.  Whilst it's about a 15min walk into the centre of Barcelona it's also only a 15min walk to the Sagrada Familia.  There were only a few times we relied on public transport as Barcelona is pretty much a flat city and so it was nice to stroll down the streets and really experience the city for what it is.  However if you do want to catch the metro it's only a 5 min walk down the road.    Overall the staff were friendly and helpful, the hotel clean and tidy and for those who want value for money I would…

title: Nice hotel for a city break
review: We enjoyed our stay in Ayre Hotel Caspe.  Plus: safe box free of charge, every day botteled water in the fridge, adequate value for what we paid, quiet and friendly area, free wi-fi. Minus: no breakfast included, a bit far from city centre (20 min walk), very early cleaning routine, only two lifts which is not enough in the busy times (7 floors), poor fitness equipment and jacuzzi was out of service during our stay. We don't think downfalls should put you off as we would recommend this hotel to our friends and family.

title: A quiet room with a magnificent view of la Sagrada Familia
review: We arrived at the hotel with trepidation.  For several months all five of us had been unsuccessful in getting confirmation that we were actually booked in this hotel.  However, our initial concerns were put aside as we were welcomed by a very gracious hotel clerk who spoke excellent English.  My husband and I had requested a room looking out on la Sagrada Familia and also one that was very quiet.  Our first room turned out to be a disappointment.  It was so small you could not move around the bed without tripping over it.  However, as requested it was quiet.  Since we were staying in the hotel for seven days we asked if we could move to a larger room but with the same view.  Despite being told that the hotel was very busy we were given an opportunity to check out three other…

title: Decent hotel, a bit out of the way
review: I was a bit underwhelmed by this hotel. I was kept awake by a buzzing, humming machine, possibly a washing machine or elevator. There are no clocks in the room. The hotel is 8 blocks from the Placa Catalunya, a 15 minute walk.

title: Very Modern Sleek Hotel, Sound Proofed to a high standard.
review: If you need a quiet room this is the hotel to go to,  they did a great job sound proofing it.  Very modern, sleek, clean hotel.  Good base for exploring Barcelona.  Good 15 min walk to Las Ramblas but we'd usually stop for breakfast about half way up each morning.  Didn't eat in the hotel so I can't rate the food.  Bar was a bit lacking in life but the bar maid was very nice giving advice etc.  Receptionists were nice also, very friendly.  Overall it was good value for money.

title: Little personality
review: We were excited about the prospect of a 'modern' hotel but apart from the lobby area we were quite disappointed. The room was quite bland and lacking with cheap-looking beech effect furniture and so on. We had a minor panic when leaving for the bus in the morning as the times on the lifts were about 15 minutes out - not exactly modern!  The staff were fairly nonchalant and ignored us for a few minutes before greeting us without as much as a smile. When we called them to ask for the wifi to be activated (as the hotel manual suggested) we were told fairly abruptly that it was already on. The bathroom was impressive and actually had two showers, but no shower gel was supplied so I had to wash with bubble bath! I also suspect the soundproofing is not great as we could hear toilets…

title: Modern, Clean, and Comfortable!!!
review: I would definitely return to this hotel!  The modern design did not make me feel uncomfortable at all.  I thought it was excellent.  The rooms are large and clean.  The elevators are large and modern.  The whole hotel is superb.  It is close to La Sagrada Familia for sightseeing, but a bit more of a hike to Las Ramblas.

title: The Staff were lovely
review: We stayed here in September 2009, and I was really impressed.  The staff are terrific, particularly Marina (French girl who works there during the day) and Oriol (Spanish guy who's a big Barcelona fan- works nights).    They give out free bottles of water to guests in the rooms, and if they have any available at reception, they can give you some there too.  The pictures of the hotel are exactly accurate, of all rooms and the entire hotel.  The place looks spectacular, is incredibly affordable, and the staff were phenominal!

title: Comfortable and Quiet
review: Close enough but not too far away from the crazy rumbling near Catalunya/Ramblas. The best part is having a restaurant and bar at the hotel when you are completely knackered and just want to hang. The rooms are clean, comfortable and quiet. The staff is also helpful and service oriented. I would stay here again.

title: modern well run hotel
review: In spite of arriving early to the hotel we were checked in and in accordance with our request, an inside quiet room. Room extremely well lit and modern, however starting to show wear and tear around the edges, but ample size with enough cupborad space to satisfy anyone. The best point was the shower "room" in the bathroom, seperate from the one over the bath, and spacious to make taking a shower a pleasure. Breakfast, included, was more than we expected, with a choice of freshly made eggs, to our liking, and ample other foods on the buffet. The hotel is situated just outside the high traffic tourist areas, with a 15 minute walk to the Ramblas, however it suited us very well.. All in all a most pleasant stay.

title: Great Value!
review: This is definitely a business hotel but it works for any kind of traveler. It’s in a great location, not in the middle of things but close enough to it where you don’t feel like it’s a schlep to get to anything. The closest metro is Tetuan but you’re also close to Arc de Triomf. The front desk is helpful and pleasant. The rooms are a good size with great closet space. The A/C was a bit tricky to manage but at least it worked. There is a great bakery two blocks away on Caspe and there’s also a supermarket across the street. I would definitely stay here again and recommend to friends.  Tip: If your luggage is heavy, take the bus from the airport so you don’t have to worry about carrying it up the stairs. The escalators are scarce here. The Aerobus goes to Pl. Catalunya (30 min…

title: Good Value
review: I have had to stay in Barcelona a few times  at the Claris and The Omm.  I couldn't get into either recently when I went to Barcelona at short notice and booked this place in a hurry. I was actually pretty impressed. The room was as good as some 5 star hotels. There was little Gym which seemed never to be busy with some running machines and rowing machine, and even his and her saunas. It is a bit out of the way  maybe 10-15 mins to Placa Catalunya but not bad and there are 2 metro stations within two blocks. Get a Barcelona travel card from the machines at the metro- the instructions are in english and it takes credit cards. The rooms on the road side could be bit noisy if you have the window open and I recognised  the complaints that others have made about the air conditioning…

title: Clean and Modern
review: Clean and Modern Hotel with modern Rooms. Rooms clean and tidy. Good size bathroom with shower and full bath. 4 mins walk from the Arc de Triomf metro station (metro exit Sortida Napols then straight up Carrer de Napols - Hotel on the right hand side where Napols crosses Carrer de Caspe). Only thing had problem with was getting to grips with the AirCon/Heating system I always managed to have it too hot or too cold. Tried to open windows but think they were sealed units. All in all Happy with the Hotel. Didn't have breakfast so can't comment

title: Nice hotel, great location
review: This hotel is in a great area - just a 10 minute walk from Passeig de Gracia in the Eixample district. Perfectly located for the metro with Arc de Triomf and Tetuan stations around the corner, and a short walking distance from the Sagrada Familia.   The staff were helpful, and while the rooms were smallish, they were clean and stylish. The walls were a little thin, but many modern hotels suffer from this problem. Around the corner, (on either C/Napols or C/Sicilia) there is a Condis mercado, which is great for picking up bottles of water or snacks.  I'd definitely stay here again for a weekend break.

title: Good value for a pleasant and stylish room
review: We chose the Ayre Caspe for its price, and we found it to be what we wanted: a clean room in good order, not far from the Metro.  The design of the room and the hotel in general, with its white walls accented in shades of blue plus pale wood and steel, was a nice bonus.  The front desk staff were extremely helpful with logistics, and the free water in the fridge was nice (given that the tap water tasted like sulfur).  The only drawback of this place is its slightly inconvenient location.  It's not a long walk to either the Tetuan or the Arc de Triomf Metro stops, but the tilted street grid made it a bit tricky to find the place when we first came in.  Your best bet is to take a taxi from the airport or train station, then use the hotel's convenient map to find your way to the…

title: Lovely hotel, good location, nice area.
review: We traveled to Barcelona to sight see before traveling home after a holiday. The hotel is in a good location, 15 minute walk to La Rambla and a 20 minute walk to the Gaudi Cathedral. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Room facilities are very good, the room and hotel in general was very clean and tidy. Parking was good value and very convenient. Would and did recommend this hotel to friends.

title: Excellent value for Barcelona
review: My partner and I stayed at the Caspe for four nights and we were over the moon with our choice of accommodation. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful [we did have a problem with the safe but after a quick call to reception this was soon fixed]. The room was serviced daily and the fridge topped up with bottled water. The hotel is situated ith L'Eixample district about ten minutes stoll to Cataluyna Square. We found the walk to be no problem with many intersting buildings to admire along the way. The hotel is also only a ten minute walk to the Sagrada Familia. To sum up we found the hotel to be extremely good value [at around 60euros per room per night,] yes you can find hotels closer to main hub but at this price you can't argue for Barcelona in peak season!

title: Nice, clean & quiet but far from center
review: We have been in the hotel for 3 nights (in a "summer dil"). the hotel is about 25-30 min walk from center, in a quiet and not very touristic neighborhood. rooms were cleaned every day, switch towels and u get free water. we didnt get breakfast because its high price. except from the distance from the center and the need to switch metros, the hotel was good, new and staff very nice (and rather handsome!) tip- ask for a room that the window is exterior...

title: Very basic, a little dull
review: I stayed in Ayre Hotel Caspe with my husband for two nights in August 2008. Having already spent about a week in BCN, we decided to further extend our stay, but our initial hotel didn't have any more vacancy and we had to change to this hotel instead. We chose it mainly because it offered a room at relatively low price, and seemed to be a modern and clean hotel. The hotel is located on a quiet side street of Gran Via and is bit far from everything, though still in the center. It was actually a little hard to find the hotel in the first place, because looking from the map, I had estimated it to be a lot closer to its nearest metro station 'Monumental'. Anyhow, the hotel is accessible by metro.  There isn't anything badly wrong with the hotel or its rooms, but the overall feel is…

title: Good for a Barcelona city break
review: We stayed two nights at the Ayre Caspe for a weekend break.  With the pound as it is we struggled to find something nice but affordable, and I think we did manage to find it with the Ayre.  It's not bang in the centre of town - about a fifteen minute walk to placa catalunya but there's a metro quite near by and taxis at night are cheap (10euros from the Gothic Quarter back to the hotel).  The room was modern and clean, although it had twin beds pushed together as opposed to a double.  Having said that the beds were really comfortable and we slept fantastically both nights.  The lobby was nice and again very modern.  The bar was good - not overpriced in the way hotel bars can be with a little outdoor sitting area where you can enjoy some lovely cava.  Staff were helpful.

title: Clean, Fresh and Pleasant Hotel.
review: Overall we had a good stay at this hotel. The first impression is the very modern reception area. It was also always well presented, clean and cool. The area the hotel was located was very quiet, and  is about 15 mins walk from las ramblas.  If not mobile it is about 5 mins walk form metro station. You can go via the Barcelona Arc de Triomphe & gardens which is a lovely walk.    The rooms also had a modern feel to it. They were clean but not the most spacious. As standard the room comes with safe for storing valuables, etc. Bathromm was clean and had a walk-in shower.  The staff were always very friendly and helpful, they can book shows, trips on request.  We stayed on a room only basis. Did not try the restaurant because it didn't look open at any time, was always empty so not…

title: Just what we wanted and great value for money
review: Myself and my boyfriend (we are aged 19 and 22) stayed here for 5 nights in August. We were very impressed with the hotel - it was modern, comfortable, the staff were very helpful and it was very good value for money considering we didn't have breakfast included. The only irk about it is that it is about a mile's walk from the centre of the city (the Plaza), which we didn't mind at all, but if you have tired legs from walking around sightseeing all day it's not something to look forward to!  The neighbourhood is quiet and safe, and a taxi into town or back to the hotel at night is cheap.  The staff were lovely, but the bar was practically non-existant as it closes at about 7pm so after a nice meal you cannot come back to a glass of wine at the end of the night.  I would…

title: Extremely Poor Service at the Ayre Hotel Caspe
review: There's something strange going on at this hotel. The maids don't clean the rooms (we came home one night at 8 p.m. to an unmade room after being gone since 10 a.m.), the wireless Internet doesn't work, and when you ask for service that is supposted to be automatic--like a fridge filled with free bottled water that replaced daily, they bring it to your door at 11.30 p.m., waking you up after you long gave up on it.  Every day we returned to the hotel (we were there 4 nights), our key card no longer was functioning and we'd have to come back down and get a new one.  It's too bad about all this poor service. Because the room was a decent size, fairly quiet (but far from the advertised "soundproof"), had A/C, a nice shower and tub, comfortable bed, but I have to say, I've had…

title: Excellent overrall hotel
review: This hotel was excellent in every aspect. It was very modern and simplistic in design but also very clean. It is a short walk to the nearest metro which links to every within the city but if you are feeling adventurous you can walk to many of the main attractions e.g las rambles and sagrada familia which are only 5-10 minute walks away. I would definately recomend this hotel and would definately go back I loved this hotel and Barcelona is an amazing city.

title: Modern hotel in the outer area of Barcellona
review: We stayed at the Hotel Caspe for three nights in the mid of may. The lounge is modern,staff is kind, concierge suggested us nice shows in the city. In ten minutes you can reach the nearest metro station (Tetuan) so to visit the city. The hotel is rated 4 stars but furniture is chep (it seems from IKEA), room is not so big, cleanness is not excellent.  Room was too warm, I tryed to set the air cooling at max without results and the windows cannot be open. Breakfast was not included in our rate, we checked in the breakfast room and we didn't see special food which justify 14€ price so we had breakfast in the nice bar near the hotel.

title: Clean hotel, good value
review: We found this hotel to be clean and a decent size, with a large bath and shower area.  It was really quiet too. The contemporary design is really appealing and it has all the facilities you need.  The beds are pretty hard but that you will find almost everywhere.  The staff, particularly the bar staff were friendly but we wouldn't recommend the restaurant for breakfast simply because there are cheaper alternatives a five minute walk away.  Our fave place within the area was La Burgalerie on Carrer De Girona.  Walk down Carrer de Casp towards the central area, Carrer de Girona cuts across.  Turn right into it and it is on the corner of the block next to a main carriageway.  It's good food, good value for money, the staff are great and there is an English version of the menu if…

title: Nice minimal hotel
review: We went for a weekend in Barcelona and Ayre hotel was very nice in a very nice quiet area, and the staff was really helpfull. Was very clean, nice and cody. Very comfortble rooms.

title: Great Hotel
review: My boyfriend and I stayed here in February 2008 for two nights.  The staff was helpful and the room was very spacious.  It is not terribly close to the center, but we walked from the center to the hotel with no problem.  As long as you have a map of the city and a map of the metro, you're set to go anywhere. The staff is more than happy to guide you.

title: Enjoyed our stay at the Ayre Hotel Caspe...
review: We stayed at the Hotel Caspe for three nights in early September. First impressions on entering the hotel were that this hotel had a modern contemporary look and feel to it, with bright, spacy areas and funky-looking furniture in the reception area. Staff were friendly and very helpful - on entering the room we found that the safe was not working and reported this immediately, at which point a member of staff was despatched straight away to our room to "fix" it. The room itself was nice and clean, and of a reasonable size with adequate furnishings and a decent bathroom. We had breakfast on the first morning, which was of a fairly good standard and of the usual hotel buffet variety, both hot and cold, but as is usual in hotels we felt the price was slightly too high and had…

title: Modern and clean but rather cold impression
review: The hotel is contemporary modern looking (for me, looked like everything was from Ikea) and clean. It was comfortable to stay but a little far from the city centre, not too far though. The nearest metro station is Tetuan and it is about 3 minutes walk. Later on, we found bus stops near by and it was easier to get to most of the popular site. On the second day of our stay, me and my friends booked the sauna, which is situated at the basement floor, so we let the receptionist know when we wanted to use as the hotel guide instructed to book it at least 90 minutes before the time we would like to use. It was great that the sauna was ready and hot when we got there. On the next day, we did the same but the receptionist (different person) said it is not necessary. However, the sauna…

title: Barcelona, Barcelona gorgeous Barcelona!!
review: Staying in Barcelona in August is very hot and crowded, but I guess that that is one of the attractions of the city: the constant bustle, noise, cosmopolitan attraction of the place is both exhilerating and exhausting. The Hotel Ayre Caspe, however, is situated away from the hurley burley of the city, yet within comfortable walking distance of two metro stations Tetuan and Arc de Triomf - both of which are within easy access of the main Ramblas district.  The hotel itself is 4* and is very chic in its presentation. It is built round a great glass courtyard (a little reminiscent of the film The Matrix in a strange way). The staff were very courteous and accommodating (although our holiday was so problem free we only saw them at check in and check out). The room was the standard…

title: Excellent Hotel
review: This is a clean, modern, well-outfitted hotel with a friendly and helpful staff.  It is near the Sacred Family church and within walking distance of the Gothic Quarter.  The hotel rooms are spacious and well-air conditioned.  Highly recommended for pre and post cruise accommodations.

title: Poor service, too far from the Ramblas, No Wi-fi
review: On the plus side, check in was easy.  We arrived quite early from our cruise ship and took a cab to the hotel, which seemed to be in the middle of nowhere.  The lobby was very large, modern and sparsely furnished - no warmth at all, and I don't mean the temperature.    Check-in was a breeze.  I had anticipated problems because of the early hour of our arrival, but there were none.  We were given a room immediately.  The room was spacious by European standards, and clean.  But the bed was hard, and when I asked if they could do anything to help, such as an eggcrate topper, I was brusquely told "no."  One of the reasons for choosing this hotel was price, which was lower due to the location.  The other was that it offered free in-room Wi-fi.  This was a necessity, since my husband…

title: Excellent Value
review: Read quite a few reviews on this hotel (and others in barcelona)  The price clinched it in the end (106 Euros a night) which seemed reasonable for barcelona  The room had a nice modern style and was certainly one of the better rooms I have stayed in. A nice touch was a bath and separate shower in the bathroom. There was free use of the safe and the aircon was permanently available (Some go off when you take the room card out). The rooms are well insulated from the outside, but not so well insulated between the rooms so I could hear the people in the next room. In fairness though every hotel I have ever stayed in I have heard noise from the next room.  The staff were really helpful with one of them taking us down in the lift to show us where the jacuzzi and gym were. We arrived…

title: Why is it so highly rated on TripAdvisor?
review: I can't quite figure out why this hotel rates so highly on TripAdvisor.  I’m not saying there’s anything terrible about the place – the rooms are a reasonable size, they’re clean, the bed is comfortable and the shower is good …. but there’s nothing great about it either – it’s a little off the beaten track and can get quite tiring to-ing and fro-ing between the hotel and ‘town’; many of the rooms look on to the atrium and have no fresh air at all; other rooms have electricity fuse boxes which hum all night, making it rather like trying to sleep through a wake up call from an alarm clock.  The breakfast bar staff were friendly – but although we ordered the same thing four mornings in a row, we got something different every time and were charged a different price every time.  We…

title: Excellent location, rooms, service
review: stayed here for two nights and had a lovely time.The Hotel is in an excellent location about 10-15mins walk to all the attractions La Ramblas etc.  Room was excellent and spotlessly clean. Reception staff were very helpful and courteous.  Found a nice local drinkery just around the corner from the Hotel and an excellent "Mexican" Restaurant within walking distance. Will almost certainly be going to Barcelona again the near future and would stay at the Ayre Caspe.  PS The only small downside to the Hotel is that the Jacuzzi is freezing!! Would definitely reccomend  the Hotel to friends and thank you to the Ayre Caspe for a lovely break.

title: Really - Can Not Recommend This Hotel!!!!!
review: I have been stolen my handbag at the bar of this hotel and I have NEVER ever seen such a lousy service, such a missing support by the staff like in this hotel. I have been travelling all over the world and still stay in different hotels on business-trips, but I have never seen something like this. There was not even an excuse by the staff, no support of delivering me the right phone number to cancel my mastercard. I gave the number of Mastercard to the staff at the reception the day I left, although I do hope that this doesn't happen to any guest again. I had and stil have a hard time to get all my documents, money back.  That's why I am writing this complaint. - There was no offer of anything or help of the hotel and again, as I can just repeat not even an excuse....-…

title: Just OK... definitely not a 4 stars
review: We chose the Ayre after reading the reviews on tripadvisor and arrived there for a 4-night stay with rather high expectations. The first disappointment came with the location of the hotel : it's not that close to a metro station (15 min. walk to Arc de Triumf) and quite far from any major tourist attraction (Closest would be the Familia Sagrada at 30 min. walk). There's nothing really of interest in the neighborhood and I'm still wondering why they chose that place to build a hotel as it suits neither a business trip need or a holiday break expectation... The staff is polite and speak several foreign languages (English, French...). Rooms are large and clean, but the overall hotel interior "design" reminds me more of an Ikea showroom : the furniture is actually made of cheap…

title: No ambience
review: Pro's: Very close to the main bus terminal, good for those coming from Girona airport. Also near 2 metro stops. Hotel is very clean to the point of feeling clinical. Nice room and very good shower in bathroom.  Cons: Staff are not very helpful with tourist advice. Resturaunt is terrible, portions are tiny and expensive.Avoid! Zero atmosphere in the hotel, suited for older travellers.

title: Lovely Hotel - But beware
review: My husband and I had stayed in Barcelona in Oct 2007 and loved the city so we booked for both sets of parents to go for their Xmas pressie.  We picked Ayre Caspe for it Trip Advisor reviews and it's proximity to the Bus Terminal ( used for flights from Gerona Airport ). It was an ideal hotel as it's only a 10 minute walk from the bus station to the hotel door. An easy walk even with cases.  Both sets of parents found the staff on reception really polite and efficient, Rooms were modern , clean and roomy.  The in-laws ate in the restuarant , they found the menu limited, priccy, small portions but of good quality.  The ' beware' was because the in-laws were mugged/conned and had their rucksack  taken (camera, glasses etc )  near to the hotel and when my parents went the same…

title: It was so so.
review: We have just returned from our stay at Ayre Hotel. Nothing to complain about. The room and bathroom were roomy and clean. The lobby, elevator and hallways seemed like you're at a clinic but who cares, you're not going to hang out there. We had trouble using the safe the first day so we called front desk and someone came up right away to fix it. Free internet in the room, so bring your laptop.  The location is residential but only 5 mins walk to the metro and 15 mins walk to La Sagrada Familia. If I had to do it all over again, I would probably pick a hotel around Las Ramblas or the Gothic area, we kept going back there for the restaurants and bars! So, make sure you get a Barcelona Card for unlimited metro/bus rides and free entry or discounts to selected museums.

title: was lovely!
review: I found the Ayre Hotel Caspe lovely. It's quite, modern and clean and not too expensive (room was 340 for 3 nights, booked from hotel website). The area is lovely, it's a residential area so not at all touristy or tacky and its only 15 walk into placa catlunya or 5 mins walk to metro stop of either arch triomphe or tetuan(with choice of more lines).  I would mention on check-in that you want a double bed (i read on tripadvisor that they give two single beds pushed together otherwise). I would also say you would like one facing the street as the rooms are bigger. We had an room facing the internal courtyard and although the bed was huge the room itself was quite small and so was stuffy.  The bathroom was nice and big with a huge walk-in shower as well as bath. Towels and bed was…

title: Not the greatest and shouldnt be a 4 star
review: We booked this hotel through laterooms at 85 Eur per night and although its advertised as a four star we were not impressed.  The location is good with about 2 minutes walk to the Metro station and its located in one of the business areas.  We used the Metro to get around Barcelona and found it fantastic and used it as late at 1130pm.  The reception area is impressive when you enter and looks very new and modern.  We were situated on the top floor and although the room wasnt very big is was modern and clean.  The downside was that they advertise soundproof walls and even if someone coughs in the hallway it sounds as though they are in your room as it does when someone showers in the room next to you.  This isnt so bad if you get up before 7am however otherwise you will be woken…

title: Excellent value for money
review: We stayed at the Ayre Hotel Caspe in Barcelona for 3 nights on a room-only basis. We did not eat in the hotel at all, only because we had breakfast in a little cafe and then lunch and dinner outside.  The hotel foyer is very modern and minimalist with funky chairs and a small pool with lights floating in it. The room we had was also modern with pale wood fittings and floor. It was well appointed with lots of wardrobe space behind Perspex sliding doors and an extensive desk area. There was a safe in the room and a fridge with complimentary water replenished every day.  The bathroom was modern with a powerful shower and separate bath also with shower over. Shower gel, shampoo, comb, toothbrushes, shower cap and sewing kit were supplied.    We arrived at 11:30am but were allowed to…

title: Loved this place!
review: Our party of four thought two nights in a modern hotel would be appropriate in  a classy city like Barcelona and we were so happy with our choice!  We loved the avant-garde setting.  The rooms were spacious and spotless.  The front desk guys were just the best in every way.  What more could one ask for?  I highly recommend the Ayre Caspe.

title: Really comfortable
review: We just spent a very comfortable four nights at the Ayre Hotel Caspe.  After several cramped, loud rooms throughout Europe, it was wonderful to have a good-sized, clean, well-furnished, comfortable and quiet room.  Yes, the lobby is ultra-modern and a bit clinical, but we care much more about the room.  After a long day of sight-seeing, I want a good bed, a well-laid-out space, and a quality shower, all of which this hotel offers. We appreciated the free bottled water and the mini-refrigerator, in which we stored lunch supplies. The location was fine for us -- a quiet street with several grocery stores and cafes nearby, and very close to the Arc de Triumpf subway station -- maybe 5 or 10 minutes walk.  Regarding the subway:  I have to disagree with the comment above.  Yes, the…

title: Excellent Modern Hotel
review: As a number of other reviewers have commented this is a very modern style hotel. The lobby area feels a little cold and was generally devoid of guests. The bedrooms are excellent with ample room, substantial closet space and expansive work desk with free broadband Internet acess. As noted by others the bathroom was well fitted with a walk-in shower plus a tub with full shower; excellent water pressure and hot water.   The front-desk staff were excellent, on check-in they didn't have my reservation (made directly on their Web site) but it took two minutes and everything was fine. We had planned on staying a total of six nights but after the first night we had to return home due to sickness, the desk agent was extremely solicitous and handled our check-out with no fuss or muss.  …

title: Ultra modern with a slightly clinical feel and quite far from the action.
review: WE have just returned from  a short three night break in Barcelona and stayed at the hotel Caspe. The hotel is decked out in ultra modern chrome and glass style, unoffensive rooms and leisure areas although we found the decor overall to be quite clinical and lacking in any kind of ambience........(this was not a huge problem though as we packed a lot into our trip and spent very little time hanging out in the hotel.) Our room was airy and comfortable (the bed extremely so!) and we managed an excellent peaceful nights kip each night. Also, the walk in shower and seperate bath was good. Having read the other reviews I did not find the staff to be unfriendly or rude but at the same time they did not fall over themselves !........(athough the barman was very chatty and helpful.)…

title: Very Poor Service
review: I just came back from a short stay at the Arye hotel, i went by the reviews on the trip advisor, while mostly i do rely on, and they have always been spot on, this time it was a bit disappointing.  Firstly as we entered the hotel to check in we found one of the most unfriendliest staff we have ever encountered in the reception area.  We enquired about the places to visit , they gave us a map, and asked to explore it.. then the price that they were charging us a bit higer then what i booked, but that was sorted out quickly. we have stayed in many 4 stars around the world but the service here was worst then 1 star. we went for a coffee at the Hotel 1898, and the reception there was extremely helpful(Even though we were not staying there), and that too is a 4 star hotel.   The…

title: A Great Hotel. Perfect location.
review: This hotel is the cleanest hotel I have stayed in.  The rooms are a good size and the bathroom was very clean with 2 showers,  a free standing one and one over the bath.  The staff on the reception are very friendly and gave us information about things happening in barcelona and how to get around. The hotel is on a perfect area, it's far enough away from the hustle and bustle of the main area, but not too far away to walk.  Approx 15 minutes, but the Arc d trioumph metro is only a few minute walk away.  The only thing I was dissapointed with, was the fact that the sauna and jaccuzi areas are seperated to male and female.  Me and my hubby were looking forwad to a lovely relaxing jaccuzzi after a long day.  ( I suppose this is not really a complaint).  The jaccuzzi and gym area…

title: Very Very Good
review: I have to say that the Ayre Hotel Caspe on Calle Casp is really something. I had a fantastic stay in the middle of Barcellona.   Location is great bacause you are far from the traffic and noises but at the same time about 15 min walking from plaza cataluna and La Rambla.  4 free bottle of water free every day. Great porter and bar service.  Very good breakfast. What else to say?   Thank you very much we will be back

title: Nice modern hotel with amenities befitting a 4* hotel
review: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights, together with 2 other friends who occupied another room.  The hotel design is avant garde and very modern, which will not suit everybody but we liked it.  The room furnishings were of a minimalist style but were all of a high quality.  The bed was nice and comfortable and I liked the fact that the room was not carpeted but done up in parquet / faux parquet.  Bathroom was large and the bath and shower areas were separate from each other.  Toiletries provided were more than adequate and their soap in particular was a very interesting translucent yellow (frivolous but it just shows the hotel's attention to detail to ensure that the entire package was consistent).  We found it difficult to work the air conditioning on the first night but a…

title: modern and comfortable
review: this is a good new hotel, with a modern design and confortable rooms. the staff is frendlily and it's a very nice choice for his price. the location is not so good, and will need to walk 15 or 20 minutes to go to the principal atracticons, but there is a tube station just two blocs from the hotel or you can take a taxi and paid around 5 euros to go to the ramblas, for example.

title: A quiet hotel
review: We stayed there for almost a week.  It is well located in a quiet neighbourhood 10 blocks from Paseig de Gracia. It may sound far, but there are 2 metro stations very close (2 blocks) from the hotel and a bus central station for intercity connections. The room was very modern, clean, well decorated, with proof sound windows. The bathroom was very good and confortable. The hotel was very quiet indeed and we could sleep really well. The only disadvantage was the breakfast, which was not included and it costs 15 euros. But just 1 block away, toward Arc de Triumph metro station there is a very popular and crowded bakery where you can eat your breakfast. The price was fair and the service was very good.

title: Ok
review: I Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in July, booked by my company since it was just around the corner from the office.  In general the hotel was fine for the location and price paid. In regard to my  negative comment below, i think i was just unlucky based on my 1st room experience and from other reviews. If I hadn't have had that, I would have probably given it 4 as the rating. Hotel is located about a 15 -20 min walk from the start of the main area (top of La rambla), and also short walk to metro.   Positives - Free internet connection (though I could not get into our work from the connection, which I have found to be a problem at the occasional hotel (something to do with there settings). butif you just need the internet for surfing etc, it is fine - neat & comfortable room…

title: A little hidden gem
review: Very good accomodation in Barcelona, close enough to the main points of interest(15 min walk from Plaza Cataluna , 25 from Barceloneta, 10 from Sagrada Familia) and 5 min from the Metro line. Situated in a very quiet street, the facade is nothing to be remembered but don't be mislead, the best is waiting for you inside.  We were a group of ten and got a very professional and fast reception, they were waiting for us and gave us ours five rooms in a minute, this is exactly what you want after a long trip. In general we found the personnell to be quite friendly and always ready to help us to choose a restaurant or call a taxi.  Rooms clean, modern and superbly furnished, bath rooms like a five star hotel. Only negative note, some rooms do not have a window open to the outside but…

title: Good value
review: I've stayed a total of 4 nights during two separate stays at the Ayre Caspe as it is actually called. I found it good value both times. The rooms are rather small, but perfectly clean and fresh. Bedlinen and towels were crisp and nice and the general areas (lobby, lobby bar, business center) all good standard.  The location of the hotel is perhaps the drawback - walking to the Born area is a brisk 15 minutes, Barri Gotic another 10. Perfectly doable but still you are a little bit away from the action. I ended up walking down to Barri Gotic/Rambla several times, then taking a taxi back. The taxi fare from Placa Catalunya was around 4 euros - quite justifiable.   I didn't have breakfast at the hotel since 14 euros seemed a bit heavy. However be aware that there aren't really any…

title: Seriously loved this hotel!
review: This is a gorgious modern hotel, situated 3 blocks from Arc de Triomphe Metro station (5 mins walk), also the long distance buses come in here as well having a 'Communter' Train station there as well. It was 15 mins walk with a case on wheels from the Placa Catalunya, where the Aeroport Bus stops, we decided to walk from here to the hotel as there was quite a few steps to tackle with the cases to get the Metro the 2 stops.  The outside of the hotel is a bit bleak, but inside.....it is lovely, the lobby is all marble and stainless steel with a water feature, up above is a modern art lighting installation, very impressive. There were 2 groups of chairs to lounge in.  Check-in was efficient, they offered to take our bags to the room, but there is no need. The room was exactly like…

title: Quiet, clean and modern
review: The hotel is four blocks away from the sub station, but it's a great neibourhood, quiet and secur. The street were the hotel is situated is also quiet so it's easy to sleep. Nice room, not too small for Europe. A shower and a bath, very modern as the room itself. We had canadian exceptation for the quality and it turn out great. The staff is ok, speaks english, helped us with our luggage (we had them delivered a day after our arrival). There's two small grocery a block away, a drugstore, a place were you can call very easily anywhere in the wold for few euros.  The hotel is near the Triumph Arch and Ciutadella park. Very nice to visit. We would recommand this hotel.

title: loved Fiesta Hotel Caspe
review: what a great hotel, I loved it. I was a bit annoyed that the internet wasn't working but apart from that it was just fantastic.

title: Beautiful rooms
review: The rooms in this hotel are beautiful.  Exactly like the hotel's website shows.  The bathroom actually has two showers - one over the tub and a separate one.  Everything was perfectly clean and crisp.  Now for the bad - the front desk has a couple of guys really not interested in helping and were somewhat rude.  I think they are more set-up for dealing with businessmen and not tourists.    Also, the location is not ideal - a far walk to Sagrada Familia, a 3.5 block walk to the metro and not walking distance to much else.  Next time I think we'll stay closer to the action.  Don't bother with the hotel restaurant - it was terrible.  Bland food and there's so much else out there.     Their business center is under construction, so no internet access at this time.

title: Excellent value
review: The hotel is a 25 euro taxi ride from the airport. It is on the road that runs parallel with the Gran Via mid way between the Ramblas and the Sagarda Familia. The exterior of the hotel doesn’t do the interior justice. It is a very modern hotel well positioned particularly if you intend to walk or use the tube to get around Barcelona. The staff were first class, we were booked in promptly and the porter was a mine of information. The rooms were extremely clean and comfortable. We had breakfast once and found it expensive at 14 euros. We have no hesitation in recommending the hotel particularly for those who wish to see the city on foot.

title: nice
review: We enjoyed this hotel, but found the service a wee bit crisp.  The location was very good, mid way between Placa Catalunya and Sagrada Familia.  An easy walk to each.  The price was reasonable.  FInding a place for breakfast in the area was difficult, but I didn't think there was an overabundance of  breakfast restaurants anywhere in Barcelona -- at least nothing that serves what Americans eat for breakfast.  Great water pressure, clean, nicely appointed rooms with soothing blond woods, and the ubiquitous Swedish modern type furnishings.  Quiet, neighborhood area which we walked after dark without feeling anxious.

title: Brilliant Barca Hotel
review: My wife and I stayed here for four days this Autumn.  The hotel is superb. It is ultra modern in style with large clean rooms and public areas that are very smart. The staff were polite and  helpful. We did not eat in the Fiesta but chose to sample local restaurants instead although we understand the Fiesta is very good for food. Try the cafe across the road for coffee and croissant at 1.65 Euros, or the cafe just up the road where an English breakfast inc juice and coffee is 6 Euros! The location is in a safe business area and there are plenty of shops and cafes nearby. The Fiesta is a good healthy walk from the centre of the city but not far from Sagrada Familia.  Barcelona is an oustanding city and this October the weather was warm and pleasant. Shorts and sandals weather. We…

title: quiet location
review: Quiet area but can walk to Sagrada Familia and Rambla or take the metro a few stops to downtown. Separate hot tubs and saunas for men and women. Did not eat at the hotel.

title: Very modern, we loved it
review: This hotel is an easy 5 - 10 minute walk from the bus depot which services Girona Airport. There is no other public transport from Girona (taxi 150 euro!) so coach at 12 euro was perfect. A new, very modern hotel. Very helpful, polite staff. Lovely large room with all mod cons. Large fluffy towels. Breakfast is an extra 14 euro, but superb buffet, or you can order cooked breakfast as well. Well worth the price. We are tourists, but this hotel would also be great for business travellers. We couldn't fault it.

title: Great Value and Location
review: Great Hotel and Location excellent value for money we stayed for 5 nights with Breakfast included. The buffet Breakfast had a great selection and they served until 11am at the week-end which was an added bonus. The facilities were good i.e. Sauna and Jacussi. Stayed in the Bar one evening and had coctails which was nice and relaxed. 15 minutes walk to Las Rambles and to the Beach. Will be going to Barcelona again next year and will stay here

title: Not bad but can do better
review: Stayed here for 2 nights recently. Hotel style is modern and they have tried to have a cool concept in design and furniture. About 15minutes walk to Las Ramblas in a very quiet residential area. Overall at 79 euros for a double not bad value but the cleaning of the rooms was average we had to call and ask for soap everyday because when they cleaned the room they didnt replace any. Also rang and asked for an iron and ironing board and was told they didnt have any and that I would have to pay 5 euros for each shirt I wanted ironed and it would take 24 hours. Overall this hotel was not bad value for money but it certainll lacked something for me.

title: Good Find!
review: Just returned from a 3 night business trip to Barcelona. What a fantastic City! The hotel which I found via your site was excellent, nice room, good facilities, air con too efficient! Nice helpful staff & above all nice a quiet & relaxed. Not too far from the main centre of things, Metro station Arc de Triomphe - 5 minutes walk away - 2 stops Place de Catalunya - Las Ramblas etc; I would certainly recommend for either business or wk/end break.

title: Great value for money
review: The pictures are precisely like the hotel - it is spotlessly clean, with no smoking in the public areas.  The staff on the reception desk are very helpful, making restaurant bookings and ordering taxis etc.  We were given a different room at the front when we asked, without any problem at all.  Rooms are spacious and comfortable, with a wonderful shower, deep bath and all the complimentary toiletires you could need: my husband forgot to bring the adaptor for his shaver, but was able to use the razor and shaving foam provided every day.  There is a fridge in the room that you can fill from the mini-market across the road, and the four bottles of water every day are complementary!  You will need to walk a good 20 - 30 minutes or take public transport to reach the majority of…

title: Tremendous Value
review: Stayed at the Caspe for 2 nights in April. First time in Barcelona and have to say that the Caspe was top class considering the price. Rooms were spotlessly clean and well appointed. Did not use the restaurant so cannot comment on this. The Hotel is not central to the major touristy bits but is only a 20 mins or so walk from either the Marina area or Ramblas. If you do not fancy walking the underground is easy to get to and very efficient.

title: Great Hotel
review: We just returned from a week's vacation in Barcelona.  There were 4 of us and we had 2 rooms on the 5th floor of the Caspe.  We will be recommending this hotel to our friends as at least one other couple will be travelling to Barcelona in the near future.  The beds were comfortable and while the rooms were small they were nicely appointed with ample cupboard space and a handy nook in between the head of the bed and the window for storing empty suitcases and golf clubs.  Also appreciated the room safe for our valuables.  (Golf courses are way out of town.  If you really want to golf perhaps stay out in the country somewhere.)  While the hotel was indeed 9 blocks from the Placa Catalunya we bought the 10 ride metro pass and walked the 3 blocks down C. de Naples to the Arc de…

title: Top class
review: This was our first visit to Barcelona and we weren't sure what to expect from the hotel, as it was at least my first time of booking my holiday completely from the Internet.  On arrival the atmosphere was very friendly and professional from the receptionists, and I didn't sense the smell of mildew at all(as one reviewer pointed out).  Our room was on the top floor and was sparkling clean with all mod cons, as shown in a previous reviewers pictures. There was no problem with noise from the street below and on the third night of our stay we slept soundly through a major storm!  We did not pay for the breakfast, thinking 14 euros was a little expensive(and not within our budget!) and so instead went to the little supermarkets and cafes within the area.  I did not feel that far away…

title: Slick
review: This was a very decent hotel, especially for anyone who doesn't mind walking. My wife and I enjoy walking through neighborhoods, so I have no complaints about being a short hike from Ramblas (which is thoroughly over-rated). Many of the things you want to go to are a 15 to 20 minute walk. Two subway lines are a few blocks away. The hotel itself is slick. Very nice design. Clean and new. Staff was great, although the women managing breakfast were a little scary. They make you pay for internet, which was a drag when cheaper hotels now provide a terminal gratis. (Also, some reviews questioned the neighborhood, but it's no problem.)

title: Great rooms
review: The rooms are stylish, clean, quiet with all conveniences, cable TV, separate shower and bath, hairdryer, efficient heat, nice view, large closets. The staff is very professional, prompt and very helpful in housekeeping and front desk and at the bar. It is centrally located, but in a mainly residential area, so I did not walk back at night, but a taxi from city central was 3 euros. The only drawback at all was that the lobby, while attractive, smelled strongly of mildew.

title: Great find.
review: We were worried that the great price for a 4* hotel may be too good to be true, but the whole stay was very enjoyable. The hotel staff were friendly and efficient and the rooms were of a high standard (The walk in showers were a big hit). Taxis to the town centre were cheap and readily available, although a couple of drivers didn't recognise the hotel name, so would suggest you know the full address. I would definitely recommend this Hotel.

title: A great hotel but 8 blocks away from the Plaza Catalunya
review: A very clean minimalistic hotel, extremely friendly staff, nice decor in the rooms, however: 1. The hotel is 8 blocks away from the main touristy area which can be too far to walk even on a hot day 2. There are no shops, bars, restuarants etc near the hotel which is a pity- as such, you end up going to the main plaza 3. the walk in shower- whilst it is extremely powerful shower, we experienced problems with the water staying in the shower area and as such the whole bathroom floor did turn into a huge puddle over the 4 days we were staying at the hotel! 4. If you are wanting a lie in, dont forget to put the 'do not disturb' sign out on the door. Whilst the maid service was fantastic, they came to clean the rooms frightfully early..9-9.30am! 5. On a non hotel related note, taxi…

title: Great hotel
review: Stayed here at the end of August for 4 days. I really liked the hotel. We didn't take breakfast but paid about £50GBP a night for a nice room.  Staff very friendly so obviously things have improved since some of the older reviews.  The Hotel is 15-20 minutes walk from the Place catalunya but 5 minutes from 2 different tube lines and 1 block from Gran Via where there are lots of buses going to near the main Shopping areas.  There is a supermarket over the road so you can stock your minibar up with fresh orange/fruit etc and as others have pointed out there is a great bakery 2 minutes from the hotel.  The hotel is very clean, the rooms are modern looking with a TV/minibar/free fresh water. We ordered tea from room service and it was about 1€50 a cup - not too bad. Our room was…

title: justa bout perfect
review: stayed here for business- rate of 103 EUR including breakfast was very reasonable. to me this is the perfect business hotel- nothing fancy, not pretentious, but all the basics were correct. clean room, modern look (yes, a bit Ikea but I much prefer clean laminate floors to dusty old carpet), free bottled water, free internet, a safe, a window that actually opens for fresh air, a small gym, clean and new bathroom. no complaints whatsoever. I accidentally forgot a shirt in the closet and when I came back 48hrs after checking out they found it within 5 minutes- housekeeping had put it aside. doesn;t always happen like that at other hotels... the hotel is not smack in the center but a 20min walk gets you there and is pleasant enough- plus a taxi ride from the center is only 5 EUR...

title: Fiesta, fiesta
review: Arrived late to the hotel and were greeted by friendly staff.  Room service finishes at 11pm and not much in the near vicinity to eat late at night.  Breakfast was not good value so ate in nearby corner cafe.  More positively the room was lovely and bright and clean, shower very good and the mirror didn't steam up, bonus!  Closely located to train to airport, Metro station and not far from the main drag.  Pretty good on a budget and wish I could have stayed longer.

title: Great find of a hotel!
review: Very clean and bright we found the hotel to be excellent value for money, at 98 euros per night over the busy Easter weekend. We are going back after Christmas and have got a rate of 75 euros. I think the earlier bad reviewers either failed to get a good deal or are not taking the price into consideration. What are they expecting, the Ritz? It's 5 mins to the Arc de Triompe metro and 2 stops to town, and a pleasant 15 minute walk to Place de la Catalunya. The rooms were great and everything was very new as it had just opened. It is in a quieter district but if you know Barcalona you will realise that no one goes out till very late, so not to be surrounded by bars etc is a benefit, you can sleep easily. I agree with the earlier reviewer about the coffee shop round the corner, it…

title: Great Hotel
review: The Fiesta Caspe hotel in Barcelona was great. The room was spacious for 2, had a nice sized bathroom, and was located in a quiet neighborhood. (only a 5 minute walk to the metro) The buffet breakfast for 14 Euros (overpriced) was not as we expected. The only good thing about it was you could order an omelet of your choice. That was good. But for breakfast I would recommend a little coffee shop, which are located around the corner from the hotel. The concierge were very helpful and spoke good English. Every day the maid service not only made up our bed, but they cleaned our bathroom and replenished free water in our refrigerator. Overall, it's a very nice clean hotel. The room looks exactly like it does on the internet. I would recommend it highly.

title: Our stay at the Hotel Caspe
review: The first impressions of the hotel was very modern, trendy and clean and was a great price for what our conformation said which included breakfast.  The room was also excelent, again very clean and was very impressed the bathroom, it had two showers and a bath, the showers were powerfull and soothing.  We went to the hotel restaurant on our first morning, there was very little choice, very little hot food, when i choose to have some hot food, the scrambled eggs were dried up, the sausages were ok, the bacon was smoked, but it was not hot, it just managed to stay luke warm. Thank goodness we did not have evening meal there.  The hotel is 20 minutes walk from the center, but if you like walking it is a nice strole.  After the first morning we went to hotel reception, and double…

title: Great Location to visit Barcelona
review: We stayed here as part of a Gate One tour.  It is located in a nice area close to everything (La Sagrada Familia, old town, Cathedral of the Sea, etc.)  The breakfast buffet was very good and I loved the Tumeric Latte they had and very good house made yogurt.  After the tour, we booked another night as we were going on to Bilbao and the Basque country after the tour concluded.  We had a couple of hiccups on this front.  First, we got locked out of our room the day the tour ended even though we had the next night booked and paid for.  Second, our room booking for the extra night came with late check out (15:00) and a bottle of Cava and chocolates.  They delivered the Cava and chocolates at 23:30 hours, when we were asleep. Then, we got locked out again the next day before checking out even though we had paid 30 euro for a 15:00 check out.  I was  disappointed that it didn't work out better and that we had to stress about the check out.  However, the staff were pleasant and friendly and I walked all over using the hotel as a base.  We did laundry, visited Antoni Guadi sites on a walking tour, and La Sagrada Familia all very easily with Google maps. I can't say I'd recommend this hotel again, as I don't know what else is out there, but it was clean and convenient.…

title: Quiet hotel with everything close by
review: Thank you so much!!! Lovely review. And, of course, we take note on your comments to improve our services and details.  See you soon!  E. García - CM Ayre Hotel Caspe

title: Great stay - very good value for money
review: Great stay, excellent air conditioning during the heatwave.  Mini fridge, hairdryer, in-room safe, great mattress and pillows as well as blackout drapery.  We walked pretty much everywhere.  It’s close to Sagrada Familia, the waterfront, Latin quarter, shopping districts.... across the street are an organic grocery, standard grocery and decent coffee place.  Biggest advantage is it is away from the really touristy noisy areas.  Would definitely stay here again.

title: Family Leisure
review: Dear Carol,   Thank you for choosing the Ayre Hotel Caspe,   We would like to take this opportunity to thank you for taking the time to share your experience. Your opinion is very important to us as it helps us to continue working every day to exceed our customers' expectations and offer an excellent service.   We are pleased to hear your stay was a pleasant one!  Thank you again and we hope to see you soon at the Ayre Hotel Caspe!   E. García - CM Ayre Hotel Caspe

title: Great hotel to explore Barcelona
review: Clean, comfortable, pleasant and very kind service. Breakfast had a great variety and was tasty. The view was not ideal, overlooking the street, but was not a problem since this was a business trip. Great location, and very easy to get anywhere from there. Close to Segrada Familia. Well spent money.
